text:
Kami berada di sana di Februari tahun ini selama bulan madu kami. Sebuah villa yang sangat pribadi, cocok untuk pasangan bulan madu yang akan mencintai beberapa privasi. Kami mengambil "Nakula" ruangan dengan deco oranye sangat cantik dan bak mandi outdoor / toilet. Sangat luas villa dan indah dihiasi dengan bunga-bunga sebelum kedatangan kami. Ketika kami tiba, kami memesan makan siang dari hotel dan itu dikirim ke kamar. Makanan yang baik tetapi akan lebih baik jika itu disajikan hangat. Salah satu pagi, kami telah sarapan di luar ruangan yang menghadap ke sebuah peternakan, hijau lezat dengan matahari pagi itu sangat menyegarkan. Kolam renang besar juga infinity kolam yang besar. Villa ini cukup jauh dari pantai dan fasilitas. Yang tersembunyi dan sangat pribadi.

Sempurna bagi mereka yang tidak ingin keributan dan keramaian Bali. Dan Ubud adalah surga bagi pecinta seni! Anda dapat menemukan kerajinan tangan dan lukisan yang indah. Kami membelinya beberapa.. haha! Murah dan bagus!
title: Bulan madu

text:
Karena sering bepergian tidak banyak tempat penginapan yang dapat mengejutkan saya.. Pandawa tidak hanya mengejutkan saya dengan pikiran bahwa semua askpeknya bagus tapi saya sangat terpesona. Situasi tenang dari Pandawa (walaupun hanya 15 menit dari Ubud) membawa anda ke gelembung kedamaian dimana anda dapat beristirahat dan memulihkan diri. Kamar yang sesuai dan mewah langsung terbuka ke dek kolam berenang dimana anda dapat menghabiskan hari sedangkan anak anda akan sibuk bermain di ruang bermain yang penuh dengan mainan dan buku. Staf sangat sopan dan sangat membantu..

Ini adalah tempat dimana saya ingin kembali lagi sesering mungkin dan sangat direkomendasikan.
title: Indah dan tenang

text:
We sent an email prior to posting this comment. It has been a few days and management has yet to contact us. 

We booked a room here after looking at the official website and from reviews from several travel sites. TripAdvisor rates this hotel as a 5 star luxury amenity hotel. It is definitely not. It close to a 3 star. This is not luxury. The room is in poor condition with several large cracks in the walls. Fridge is rusted and barely cold. Shared swimming pool is murky. Service is poor. We were not immediately greeted at the door and had to flag down a worker. Staff did not know the WiFi name or password. Major construction was being done next door and made the entrance look like a junk yard. It was not inviting. We did not feel safe with only a turnkey as a lock. Needless to say as soon as we found WiFi we booked another hotel. We did not get any money back. It was not even offered. 

Our room was called “deluxe room terrace” which is conveniently not pictured on their website or on Tripadvisor. The quality is not even close to those villas pictured. There is no terrace. A patio was listed in TripAdvisor and there was none as well. We were adjacent to the main lobby and could hear the phone ring every time. The bedroom has two walls all windows. Sure they give you blackout curtains, but even with the blinds closed and curtains drawn, it feels awkwardly dark and everyone is literally on the other side of your room.  The free shampoo, soap etc were all mismatched. Only the bathroom seemed updated. 

Bottom line. Don’t stay here. We wanted to celebrate our honeymoon in a beautiful 5 star villa and this place was extremely disappointing and deceptive in its advertising. It may have looked 5 star when it was built but not anymore. TripAdvisor needs to update this listing.
title: NOT a luxury 5 star

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your review. 

You came with the expectation of a hotel where as we have only promoted the property as a villa. It has 6 rooms and a common half olympic size shared pool. The pool is a natural pool and does not have city ceramic tiles which you wanted - this pool is made of natural limestone. Your expectation of a property with many tall buildings within the property and full of electronic gadgets is not something we have promoted or shared across any site. 

You booked the deluxe terrace room which is our standard category room but has a huge private terrace all to yourself. However you wanted a room with a city feel. Ubud is not a city feel place - its a jungle - there are paddy fields, its quiet, people come here to relax to rejuvenate and to get away from electronic room feels. Standard room as per website and all sites - is a room that meets guest requirements and is different from the luxury villa room which is our luxury category which we offer in our other rooms. 

You were however quite rude to our team - they tried to talk to you and offer you a free upgrade but you were not willing to listen to any of the staff. Ubud is a green feel - the entire property has few walls and more glass doors so that you can open and soak in the fresh village air and feel. As part of the management team - we agree you are a complete mis-match to the village feel we offer at the Pandawas. Our only request to you - if you want only a city feel within a property - please do your research well before booking. As much as it was not a comfortable feel for you - it is also upsetting for us when guests such as yourself speak impolitely to the team. The team only wants guests to be happy - hence it is important to show respect and patience. 

kind regards
Pandawas 
Management Team

We had a delightful stay at Pandawas Villas, it felt much more like being welcomed into a home than staying in a tourist villa.  
We had a very comfortable villa.
Wayun and all the staff were friendly, helpful without being obtrusive.  We appreciated the free shuttle into Ubud and advice on tour options.

The pool is a good length for laps and the setting is very beautiful.  It does need a little maintenance as some tiles have come off the floor of the pool.

We enjoyed our breakfasts at Pandawas but can’t comment on other meals as we did not eat there.

text: We were very excited about travelling to Pandawas Villas having read all the excellent reviews online, but, unusually, it did not meet our expectations. I find it strange how people can consider it 5* when it quite clearly is not. Maybe it was unique to our experience, but having stayed in a great many 5* properties, this was some way off the mark. I will start with the positives: 1) the staff were mostly friendly and tried to help whenever we asked, 2) the free shuttle in and out of Ubud was a really nice touch (although also very necessary), 3) the pool is very picturesque (although cold and a bit murky), 4) the upstairs rooms looked really nice (ours was the only one downstairs - The Drupadi Room). The issues started on arrival for us. The warm welcome promised from other reviewers didn't materialise. For a start, there is a building site immediately outside the front door but no-one came to greet us or help us with our bags. The girl behind the reception desk looked nervous and unsure what she was doing. Nothing was explained to us - how to get food, how to order a drink, possible trips and activities, nothing at all. I would not say anything was wrong with the service per se, but it was nowhere close to the warm, friendly and informative welcomes we have received in virtually every other place in Bali during the two times we have visited. We were shown to our 'new' room and found it deeply underwhelming. It is not so much the bland decor or bright pink feature wall that put us off but more all the small things you just don't expect to be wrong in a 5* establishment - no curtains to block out the morning light, a mosquito net that didn't fit the bed, dirty pillows under the clean covers, a shower that didn't drain properly, a shower shelf that was poorly fitted to the wall. Some unsavoury-looking stains on the two bright pink bean bag chairs propped against the wall opposite the TV. Significant cracks in the walls which looked ominous. And all of this was on top of the fact that the room was under the hotel decking, so you could hear anyone walking overhead. We had to find out a lot of things for ourselves. No drinks menu ever emerged, if there was one, and when we asked for food, we received a very tired looking menu which we ordered from for one night only. The food was perfectly fine but lacked any sense of 5* quality. Exactly the same could be said for the breakfast - a really nice touch to have it brought to the room and perfectly fine, but without any real sense of class about it. We did ask if tours were available and a brochure was produced from which we selected the half-day tour, which went well. Nobody at the hotel asked us how it went. In fact there seemed to be different people on the desk every time we were there (and sometimes no-one at all) - the much-championed owner, from other reviews, did not seem to be around at all, which was a shame, because the staff urgently needed someone to model good practice. This came to a head when I had to show the man behind the reception desk how to work the card machine when it came to checking out! Very rarely do I disagree with TripAdvisor raters, but on this occasion I really do. Perhaps it was the room, perhaps it was the time of our visit, perhaps it was just bad luck, but I was wondering whether I should have booked Royal Kamuela (our last hotel from a few years ago) and I deeply regret not doing so. And this is not just about expense. We have just arrived at Tito Villas on the north of the island, a fraction of the cost of Pandawas, and it has exemplified everything Pandawas is not - superb customer service, tasteful rooms with attention to detail, stunning decor, and staff who go out of their way to make the experience an enjoyable one. Pandawas may be an oasis of calm in Ubud to some, but to me it is a hotel that doesn't know who it is and who is over-luxuriating in 5* reviews it doesn't really deserve. Could do so much better with some attention to detail and staff training.
title: Adequate but not 5*

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your feedback. At Pandawas we always try to make our guests smile and take back happy memories. We are sad to read that your stay with us did not meet your expectations. Most of our guests have found the team always welcoming, kind, helpful and friendly. That is one of the reasons we have always received a 5* rating from our guests. 

You checked in during Kunningan which is a holy festival in Bali. Most staff are on leave at this time of the year. The staff on duty was a trainee when you checked in and if she was nervous – it’s perfectly fine. As a trainee we are all nervous. She did her best to help you, talk to you, reply to your questions as best as she could. The older staff on duty attended to you as fast as he could. Bali is a rural holiday destination – everyone is polite and courteous and there is no hurry to get you into your room the moment you arrive – we usually wait for the guest to be seated, relax, enjoy the welcome drink and then we guide the guests to their rooms. For all of this you need to be patient, sit back and enjoy. We do not have a policy to jump on the guest the moment they arrive and bore them with commercials do’s and don’t s. 

We would also like to share – you booked the deluxe terrace room and not the luxury villa room. As in hotels, in our villa also there are “room types” – while all rooms offer comfort and relaxation – there are bound to be differences. Your room has a stunning terrace deck overlooking the beautiful jungle – a view many desire. A happy soul smiles in the face of nature – we are sad to read all you could find were cracks. You could have also discussed all your confusions and complaints with the staff the next morning – however you did not say a single word to any of the teams working morning or evening. The teams have been trained to not be in your face – that we believe is good practice. If you prefer hotel desk service with phones ringing and buzzers buzzing, then most definitely a villa is not a suitable place for such guests. We do believe strongly in over-luxuriating our guests with peace and happiness. 

We thank you once again for your feedback. We also appreciate that you are a smart budget traveler – you negotiated with the staff for drop to a location which is a 3-4 hours’ drive and were not willing to pay the requested taxi amount. Please do understand – taxi drivers work hard too – the given driver came on our request only to help you – since mostly everyone in Bali was on leave -and therefore if someone comes to work on their special holy day, the point needs to be respected. 

The team knows how to take care and make guests happy. We hope all our guests always stay happy and blessed. 

Kind regards

The Pandawas
Management Team

text:
I can't say enough good things about the staff and property at Pandawas Villas! First of all, the villas are quite large and the outdoor bathroom is really unique and enjoyable. There are only 4 villas at the property so it's very quiet. The villas face the large pool and the jungle. We even saw about dozen monkeys up in the trees as we were sitting by the pool! Breakfast was included and it was fantastic. They serve it to you wherever you'd like to eat, be it in bed or by the pool with views of the jungle at whatever time you'd like. Eggs cooked to order, fresh squeezed juices, tea or coffee, fruit, bread or croissant. 

Contact the staff in advance if you need transportation from the airport. They arranged it for us at a good price. Same for a tour of the Tegallaland rice terraces, elephant cave, a temple & a coffee plantation as well as our ground transportation to our next stop, the Hilton in Nusa Dua. We also booked several massages while we stayed here and they were very reasonably prices and good. I believe it converted to be around $15 for an hour massage. 

They also have a shuttle that will take you it to town. We found it was often more efficient to just take a taxi back to the villas from Ubud but great option for getting into town, and it's free. 

I would recommend Pandawas Villas to anyone traveling to Bali. It is a great value for the price, the staff & grounds are fantastic and the cooked to order breakfast can't be beat!
title: Immaculate Property & Attentive Staff in a Serene Jungle Environment

text:
First of all, thank you dear Pandawas team, you made ours six days in Ubud just perfect. We really enjoyed every minute at the Pandawas Villas. Due to a delay of our transport we arrived late at night at the resort, but wehe staff waited and gave us a very warm welcome. Even the Barwas closed, they served us a couple of cold drinks and made the arrival very comfortable. 

The staff was all the time very thoughtful and attentive, so revelry question was answered and any help was given, transport to Ubud, renting a bike, hints what to do. 

So if you want to escape the hustle of Ubud, which can be very crowded and stressful sometimes, the Villas are the perfect place to enjoy the beauty of the Ubud area and relax in this beautiful resort. The Villas are extremely spacious, the bed is very comfortable, the technical equipment is REALLY good, so you have a decent mataranz Amp with surround you, an iPod doc (only 30 pin adapter, but works fine), a 3,5mm audio jack, to connect your device, many power jacks, good wifi (enough for streaming netflix) and in the lounge, there is a PS3...  if you really don't know what to do ;-) but the best thing is, there are only 4 Villas, so it will never get crowded (if you like that). The whole are of Pandawas is beautiful arranged, many ponds, gardens, flowers... is all very nice. The pool has a really good size, so it stretches about 20 meters or even more, so serious swimming is possible.

So all in all, great accommodation, super friendly staff, perfect situated, and just beautiful ;-)

One hint... if you are into breakfast,: they don't have a buffet, you can choose between, continental, American and pancakes. If it's not included in in your rate, they charge 140.000 IDR

text:
We staying at Pandawa villas with our toddler and baby for 4 nights. 

Pros: The villas are spacious and beautifully designed, really very lovely. The bed was very comfortable and everything was very clean. The location is around 10-15mins from Ubud and they offer free pick-up and drop off which was great. 
The staff at the villas were amazing. There were very helpful and did their very best to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. We also took advantage of the massage service that was offered and it was very good and well priced.

Cons: The outdoor bath has been converted into a shower, so whilst there are pictures on their website and marketing to relax in this beautiful outdoor bath, this is no longer the case and that was pretty misleading. I had actually chosen this villa over a few others I was looking at because of the large outdoor bath. As I have a toddler and baby I thought that a lovely outdoor bath like would be sort of like having our own private plunge pool, but without the drowning risk for the toddler, so I was quite disappointed to find no bath. The water pressure was also terrible. They have these beautiful large rain shower heads both in the outdoor shower and over what was the outdoor bath, however the pressure is so terrible that when turned on full a trickle just dribbles out of the middle of the showerhead and can't even fill 85% of holes to form raindrops. It was similarly bad in the handheld showerhead. I expect this may have something to do with why there is no longer the ability to fill the bath as it would probably take 2 days to fill it! I did get someone to come to the room and check the pressure and complained about it however there was not much he could do and said it was how it was. The staff were very thoughtful however and did bring me a baby bath to wash my baby in given there was no useable bath in the room. 
There is quite a bit of maintenance work needed, mostly lots of little things. The toilet, for example, was not cemented properly to the floor, so everytime you sat on it or got up it would wobble, pool tiles coming loose, and several little annoying things like that. On the last day my husband walked onto the deck outside our room and near put his foot right through it as the wooden decking had rotted through. Our side of the pool was much better than the other side however which was really terrible and scary to walk to for fear of falling through and I kept my toddler well away from that side. The rest of the grounds (away from the villas and reception) also needs maintenance. 
Food ordered to the room comes from off-site and ours arrived cold and didn't look so fresh so I wouldn't recommend that. Breakfast wasn't particularly great either however it was fresh. I also tried to order several drinks off there drinks menu however many of the items were not available which was annoying (if not available don't put it on the menu). There were no tea or coffee provisions in the room which was annoying and I really didn't want to call up to both someone late at night to get one nor wait to have it made (and pay for it).

Overall this villa has so much potential. The rooms are fantastic and the overall setup and design of the villas/ reception/ pool areas has been very nicely done. The staff are also already fantastic and I couldn't rate them highly enough. If management sharpened up their game they could easily make this a true 5 star villa. It's the little things like tea/ coffee, having enough towels (not having to ask for enough towels), plus pool towels, and taking care of all the little maintenance things for example which makes all the difference.The water pressure also must be fixed and marketing material changed to make it clear there is no bath.
In its current state I'd rate it fairly at about 3.5 stars. We did have an enjoyable stay overall (but just not quite the 5 star level we were used to and expected).
title: Wonderful staff and amazing room but needs some maintenance

text:
My girlfriend and I stayed at Pandawas Villas for about 7 nights at the end of December 2016 and it was EXTRAORDINARY!  First, I must say that Pandawas is not directly located in Ubud…and that this is a very good thing.  The villas are in Tegallalang (sp?), only a short ride from town, but it makes all the difference.  It provides a very relaxing escape from the busy streets of Ubud.  

The property has beautiful lush flora, a large pool, and the villas are quite large and spacious.  The outdoor bathroom is incredibly relaxing as you awake in the morning and shower.  You may even have visits from critters on the property, as a macaque briefly stopped by while we were there.  It’s just a very relaxing and beautiful property.  

In addition to the perfect property and room, the staff was probably the kindest and most accommodating staff that I have ever interacted with.  I wish that I could recall all of there names (it has been awhile) because they deserve acknowledgment.  There are certain times when free shuttle service is available, and when we accidentally missed the window a couple of times, they took us to town regardless because you can tell they just want you to be happy.  

We enjoyed the breakfast options at Pandawas.  If I had to give just one minor criticism, it is that ordering your food is not very convenient, as I believe the food is prepared either off property, or it just takes a while to prepare it.  You have to order meals in advance, which can complicate things if you don’t have a set itinerary.  Still..this is just one minor thing in the grand scheme of it all.  

Just a special note here: walk uphill along the road that led to Pandawas.  You will eventually pass into a village after a 15-20 minute walk. Although the dogs were a little intense (they bark like crazy), it was a very educational experience to see a Balinese village and was something I’ll never forget. It was no “tourist trap”…just people going about their day.  

Overall, I highly recommend Pandawas for the beautiful and serene property, and the amazing staff.  Thank you all for giving my girlfriend and I a wonderful experience.
title: A perfect oasis close to Ubud

We rented a scooter which was a game changer and made it possible for us to relax completely, not having to follow any time tabel. Ubud and the surroundings and great. Ubud has a very hippie, yoga, vegan vibe, that is really relaxing. 

Padawas Villas is recommended if you want to pull the plug in complete luxury.

text:
Arrival and service in general - no one ever around.  had to constantly look for staff to get a drink or order food.  Food was OK.  Not the typical standard of Ubud.  Indonesian menu could do with more options/variety.  Range of food was poor (why so much Indian?).
Common areas/dining area - lovely and ambient, but not exactly well maintained; the decking around the pool is rotting, the pool lounge chairs/beds are on their last legs and the cushions were thin, ripped and dirty.
Room - Spacious but very dated.  Furniture was old, worn and a bit greasy.  Huge bed but mattress hard as a rock, only a very thin mattress cover (terry towelling) without a pillow top or decent level of protection from actual mattress.  Did mention this to staff who suggested they could try to find a different mattress but that was it.

Ants everywhere even in bed which I know is part of staying in the jungle but these suckers were biting.  Thankfully, there were hardly any mosquitos.  

Had a massage - that was pretty good, seems that they outsource it from somewhere else though.

Noise - woken up at 5am by cars and motorbikes in 1st or 2nd gear trying to get up the big hill that the resort is on.  Also the aircon in the room was quite creaky.  Probably not a big deal unless you're a light sleeper or would rather hear the sounds of birds/nature, as we prefer.  

We were booked in for 4 nights but checked out after the first night as the Villas really don't live up to the advertised conditions or photos.  The whole place needs maintenance and new furniture, its very dated - circa 1970 maybe - and we were generally just very uncomfortable there because everything we sat on was either rock hard or about to break or covered in grime.  Really easy stuff to fix/maintain but it looks like the garden and the pool get the maintenance money but little else.  Place has real potential but its not managed well (didnt see any management staff at all) nor did the staff seem to take pride in their Villas or their customer service.  I did discuss this with the receptionist who said it was not part of their policy to provide refunds for guests who weren't happy although she'd speak to a manager.  I was not asked if i'd like to speak to the manager which may have been more productive.  Was eventually offered 50% off of the last night (so about $60) - which was more insulting than anything and I politely declined and asked them to put it toward investing in mattress toppers for the beds.  Very bad customer service policy in my opinion - you never tell a guest that you don't refund in the event they are unhappy.  I think the general norm is to first apologise and then offer complimentary meal or a drink and if there is no solution to the noise / bed issue - discuss cancellation terms.  They were VERY keen to be paid for all charges upfront as well - that should have been the first indicator that the priorities of the place were a bit off.
title: Uncomfortable despite lovely Ubud surrounds

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your review. 
Ubud is a place to come and enjoy nature - we have promoted the open spaces and tranquility and open bathrooms through all sites. For those who need a city feel - we always advice staying in 100 room hotels. Our villas only have 4 villa rooms spread across 7000sq.m of land and the staff have been trained to be inconspicious. 

The feel and ambience as the name suggests is minimilistic and rustic. Again if you need modern feel - its always best to opt for city hotels. We use the best possible mattresses - King Koil Chiropracter (this point is clearly stated in the website) - which are top of the line. Many city hotels use spring beds - if your requirement is a basic spring mattress then again city hotels are the best option for your family. 

We apprecaite all your feedback. However the issue was not so much in our villas as it was in your need to leave for Jimbaran post discovering that some of your friends are around in Bali. You wanted to take the opportunity to check out earlier than committed and move into the villas your friends had booked. Since we were fully sold out we could not offer any rooms to your friends. That was when you started making a fuss about everything around you which for the first 2 days of your stay did not seem to bother you at all. 

Ref Menu - we offer a complete range of Salads, Breads, Indonesian, Balinese, Italian & Indian foods. There is a lot of choice for 4 villa rooms. Again if you prefer to eat pre-prepared frozen foods thats not a choice on our menu - please do understand we only cater to fresh foods - our motto is Eat Healthy Freshly Prepared Foods!

kind regards
Pandawas Villas Management Team

text: This hotel consists of 4 villas set around a beautiful pool overlooking the jungle. The set up is good for young kids- you can see your room from the pool and lobby/dining area so can keep an eye on a sleeping child while not actually being confined to the room. The hotel is out of town so you need a driver to get into Ubud, but this was easily arranged with the staff (and not charged, even though we didn't go at the specific shuttle times). The downside of the location though is that you cannot walk to any shops or restaurants- there is a big steep hill to get to the villa so you are essentially marooned there without transport. Some minor negatives- food & drinks at the villa took AGES (1hr+) to be delivered once ordered, and were overpriced. Breakfast however was very good (included) although be clear about your order as they got it wrong with us. The mosquito net provided for the childs cot did not fit; our daughter got bitten. Staff leave doors open letting mosquitos in. Obviously not a concern for them but it was for us. Overall this was a good place to stay, but be aware of the above points.
title: Large rooms & lovely setting in jungle

text: If you want to experience tranquility and bliss in the middle of the rainforests of Ubud, then this is the place to stay. We stayed at Pandawas for 3 nights and were delighted with the experience. Unlike most of the hotels and resort rooms, the room here was massive, tastefully done up and came along with, a rainforest shower. The grounds are lush with Koi ponds surrounding the villas and our stay was complimented with all the amenities you would expect from a 5 star resort. The main Patio or Lobby, with its beautifully carved rooF,  is great to lounge around in and enjoy a cup of coffee. The fact it overlooks the infinity pool is a Bonus. Due to limited number of villas, we were able to relax and enjoy the infinity pool which over looks the paddy fields, with complete privacy.  Whats more, when we needed a separate bed for our 8 year old, the lovely staff was glad to oblige. Personally, I found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. In fact, when me and my son wanted to go to the main square in Ubud,  2 of the staff members volunteered to give us a ride on their motorbike as waiting for another half hour for the shuttle service would mean that we would have missed out on a performance that we were keen to catch. We had an absolute blast!!!  I would highly recommend Pandawas Villas to everyone and in fact look forward to coming back next year. Hopefully for a much longer time!!
title: An Absolutely Delightful and a Tranquil Experience

text:
This is a very peaceful and pretty place, the gardens and grounds are really beautiful, with great staff, highlights:
Pros:
- very peaceful
- very big spacious rooms with well done and big indoor/outdoor bathroom
- very comfortable and big beds, we stayed in one villa with our two daughters, aged 13 and 11 and there was plenty space for all four of us
- the pool is big and nicely done, although the odd tile needed fixed
- very pretty grounds and gardens and nice jungle outlook from the villas and the pool
- great staff, very helpful and friendly (although occasionally things got lost in translation which is fair enough)
- tastefully done overall
- good breakfasts served outside villa or in communal very large central area
- great local village walk with guide one of the villa staff, definitely recommend doing this as it was very pretty walking through the local rice fields and very interesting walking through the village and seeing the local temple, although it was a bit overpriced especially for the four of us
 - good value

Cons
- a bit tired in parts, so don't expect brand new 5 star but easy to get over this
- a bit out of Ubud town (around 10-15mins drive), although generally the villas shuttle was readily available to take us in and pick us up, and when not it was easy and cheap to get a cab

Overall would highly recommend staying here, especially with the right expectations.

text:
I must begin my review with a disclaimer: I made a reservation a long time ago but tried to cancel within the 30 day period, which could not be done.  Thus I was quite disgruntled when I showed up there 2 weeks ago for a 5 night stay.  Nobody is more surprised than I am now, to find myself utterly in awe and in love with this place and its people. If you've been there, and experienced its magic, you know what I mean.  It is like no other.

Before we got there, I wrote to the villa to see if I could request for the Nakula villa.  To my delight, they granted my request!  So we had this spectacular view of the greenery on one side of the room through big windows, and it was a joy to wake up to it every morning.  The beds were firm and comfortable, and we slept soundly thanks to the AC and mosquito nets.  Because there are only 4 villas, and everybody came and went at different times, we did not see anybody else at the pool whenever we went swimming, which was almost every day.  The infinity pool is beautiful, just big enough to have  a good swim but not too big to intimidate.  My children had so much fun in it.  They clean it meticulously every morning before the guests use it.  

The best part about Pandawas is its people, and how discreet they are.  They quietly take care of everything for you, from cleaning to cooking to serving, but then they leave you alone, and don't hover over you.  If we were not having jet lag and waking up in the wee hours to see them work, I swear we would think that this place just runs on its own.  You rarely see anyone around.  Even the people at the front desk are quiet, though polite and friendly.  Wayan is always ready to give us a ride to or from downtown Ubud whenever we ask, and he is patient and kind.  Ani is sweet and friendly and loves kids.  Their breakfast offerings are excellent, but you need to order it the night before and let them know when and where you want to eat it.  As a rule, whatever you want to eat, you need to give them at least a 2 hour notice,

The only complaint I have is that sometimes the electric current gets all wacky, and the lights and AC will flicker on and off for a few times in a row.  The first time it happened in the middle of the night, at 4am, the lights turned on and off repeatedly and woke us all up.  Since we were already suffering from a jet lag, we gave up on sleep soon after that.  It happened again during the day before we left.  Each time it would repair itself and go back to normal.  Also the wifi is quite spotty.  I could never get any sort of connection in the bathroom, but if I move to the front of the villa it's ok.  BTW the bathroom is gorgeous, I could spend all my waking moments there.

On our last morning there, my husband and I decided to have a Traditional Balinese massage.  That was icing on the cake.  Our masseuses were excellent, and it was done in one of the cabanas facing the greenery, so we could hear (but not see) our children playing in the pool while we got pampered.   It was a total bliss!

In the end I am happy that I did not manage to cancel my reservation at Pandawas.  Our Bali memory was luscious and beautiful, thanks in no small part to our stay at Pandawas,  Yes it would have been better if it were closer to downtown Ubud, instead of taking 15 minutes to get there.  But we enjoyed coming back here, to our retreat, at the end of every busy day, to soak in its pool or shower in its turkish bath.  We loved waking up to the soft light that sneaks into our room every morning.  We revel in exploring the grounds, and discovering the viewing platform that has a view of the rice terraces nearby.  It *IS* heaven on earth.  Thank you, Pandawas.
title: Amazing Grace!

text:
Spent the last night of a long honeymoon at the Pandawas and it was simply the best out of all the other 5 places I stayed at during my almost month long visit to Bali.

The place spells character from the moment you walk in. You a greeted by a huge lobby much bigger than most big resorts and here we are talking about a place with just 4 Villas. The Villas are just fantastic facing the pool and facing the lovely green forested valley in front. 

The room besides the excellent artworks had things like a Copper Bath Tub (yes actual Copper), Copper Wash Basins, Batik linens and an Entertainment system with an Amplifier and Roof mounted speakers for a surround effect. These are just a few of things I noticed and I dont recollect such things in any other room that I have ever stayed at.

And of course the Hospitality was par excellence and the people around were impeccable when it came to service whether it was moving our luggage to our room or arranging our Airport drop.

The fact that there are just 4 Villas makes it the ideal place if peace and quiet are what you are looking for. Perfect for Honeymooners. And if you need to be in the hustle and bustle Ubud Market is just a few kms away and the shuttle gets you there in 10 minutes.

All in all a perfect place. Can hardly wait to visit this Gem of Ubud again.

My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon. We had intentions of finding a true getaway spot in South east Asia with true adventure, luxury and culture. Set in busy ubud yet surrounded by nature at its finest. We were greeted by the most professional and well mannered staff we have experienced in all our travels. Our accommodations were nothing short of 5 star luxury in true balinese villa style. Beautifully carved high ceilings, ample room space and wardrobes, with an amazing outdoor bathroom which was an experience of its own. The meals prepared at the villas were fresh and extremely appetising as all ingredients are either grown and sourced in the grounds gardens or locally sourced from fresh markets and farms only hours before the meal. The staff was extremely helpful in planning out our stay in Bali, and booked all attractions for us with transportation arranged. We felt truly pampered for the 6 days we stayed there. 
A highly recommended location for anyone visiting Bali. Will be back ourselves very soon!

text:
These villas are about 5km (15 minutes by car noting traffic) from the centre of Ubud.  There are only four villas in the complex which results in the setting being very peaceful.  The villa is well appointed with a huge internal area and outdoor bathroom.  There is a beautiful pool overlooking the rain forest, as well as a large living/dining area and TV room.  

Breakfast was good each morning, though the options could do with a spruce up. There is also the option of pre-ordering dinner to have at home (noting there are no restaurants an easy stroll away). 

There are three shuttles to Ubud and back each day, otherwise it costs around IDR70,000 to get there.  This is convenient, though, given the size of the complex, it would be nice if there were more flexibility in the times.

The only issue encountered was a power outage at night that lasted for a few hours and made the room uncomfortable, though this is commonplace in SE Asia.

I would recommend staying here if you don't mind being out of town and, particularly, if you have a group of 6 to 8 and can hire the entire complex.

Overall very good.
title: Very good

text: This place is AMAZING! My husband and I just spent five nights here, and it was totally worth it.  There are only four rooms, so it is very private and the service is great.  We ended up spending most of our time at the hotel-- because it was as if we had our own private resort!  Definitely recommend the room on the end with the view.  The rooms are huge, and everything is beautifully decorated.  We enjoyed the beautiful pool, having a massage on the deck, sipping mango lassies in the shade, could not ask for much more.  The food was excellent as well.  The actual resort is close to Ubud but far enough away you feel like you are in your own private villa- surrounded by trees. Would definitely stay there again!

text: I searched a lot of places, particularly for a villa with an infinity pool overlooking the forest. Pandawas met every desire. In fact, because there are only 4 villas, it's more private than other locations that cost a lot more; we were often the only people on site and in the pool. We were also the most fortunate to reserve THE BEST room in Nakula with a wall of windows overlooking the forest right next to the bed. The staff is very friendly and the food was very tasty. The decor pops with beautiful art and architecture. The grounds are also just next to a rice field. You can also walk up hill about 10-15 minutes and check out a small local village (Kepitu?). The only cons, which are by far outweighed by all the pros, are the toilet seat needs to be changed, the complimentary shuttle only runs a few times per day, and the food is expensive. (If you want a change of scenery and food, you can walk 5 minutes up hill to The Kayon, which had only opened for business 3 days upon our arrival.) And for romance, definitely take a bath! Overall, if you want to experience a slice of heaven, visit Pandawas and you will be in a dream...
title: Heaven on Earth!

text:
YES, IT CERTAINLY WAS A GREAT EXPERIENCE TO ENJOY OUR HOLIDAY AT 'THE Pandawas Villas, Ubud, Bali

We were surfing for information about suitable Villas in Bali; and suddenly, as a matter of good luck we happened to get in touch with our Australian Friendly couple who had gone for a holiday some time back.  It was they who strongly recommended us the place - The Pandavas Villas at Ubud, Bali. Having full faith in their recommendation we booked ourselves to spend our holiday.  This was our first visit to Bali and we had gathered some information about the Indonesian Island, which is known for its ancient Hindu Culture.

We were indeed wonder struck when we checked at The Pandavas Villas.  They had arranged for us transport to pick us up from the airport.  We have already visited many countries - United States, Switzerland, France, Hongkong, Singapore, Malaysia, and stayed in the Hotels & villas there.  But the experience we gathered and enjoyed at the Pandavas Villas was so much unique that it has inspired us to share it for the benefit of many around the world who we do not know; but would be glad if they also experience the same enjoyment as we did.

The Pandavas Villas is a self-contained resort with Five suites, a private swimming pool, two massage cottages and in-house dining facility.  The suites are of the same size - sprawling, with huge bathrooms attached and kind size twin beds with all other five-star facilities.  But the experience of staying there gave us a feeling as if we were in a small palace in a thick jungle, & very well protected.  Enjoying the swimming pool just outside our suite any time of the day was an experience which we had never enjoyed anywhere else.  The linen provided was extremely comfortable and clean.  But for our return bookings done in advance and our commitments back home, we would have been too pleased to extend our stay there for a few days more; but unfortunately it was not be so. I saw a lot of young and senior citizens like us have an equally enjoyable time.

 We shall treasure with us the memory of our stay at The Pandavas Villas for a long time and may be, not too far in the future, we shall visit Bali again for a slightly longer holiday and refresh our pleasant memories of enjoying the stay at The Pandavas Villas once again.

Maya & Prem Gandhi

New Delhi 
India
title: Excellent Experience

Dear Guest,

Pandawas Villas Management Team

text:
We stayed at Padawas for 4 nights in the beginning of July with our two boys, aged 7 and 5. On arrival after 20 hours in transit from South Africa we were very tired and what a welcome it was to arrive at Pandawas. 
Our late arrival due to a missed connection was accommodated without a glitch and Wayan waited for us with a friendly smile at the airport. 
In my opinion the internet pictures don't begin to do justice to the lovely setting - it truly is beautiful, quiet and peaceful. We checked into Nakula villa and were very comfortable there. The room size is enourmous and ample for a family of four.
Our daily breakfast was large and delicious.
Wifi reception was excellent everywhere on the grounds and in our room - something we struggled with further on in our travels at other establishments.
One might find many places to stay in Ubud with a beautiful setting and lovely rooms and grounds, but what must set Pandawas Villas apart is certainly the wonderful staff - Wayan Muliawan, Ani, Kadek and Wayan Tirta. They were friendly, accommodating and amazing with the kids. There were many more groundskeepers and kitchen staff that we didn't interact with that must have worked equally hard as the food was excellent and the grounds well-kept.
If I come back to Ubud, I am definitely coming back here!
title: Truly excellent

owner_response.text:

kind regards
Pandawas Villas Management
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I with my family stayed at the Pandawas villas In July 2014 . The Villa was beautiful and service was outstanding. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and went out of their way to ensure we had an enjoyable stay.
The location of the Villa is such that it is on a hill and right in the middle of forest like area and you can appreciate the privacy and close contact with nature. From the time you are collected from the airport, it's just all so refined and hassle free. From the second we arrived, we were treated like royalty, and the greeting involved a little cultural touch as well. The surroundings of this resort are breath taking, and the employees were very professional and friendly. 
The rooms are really big and well maintained and so are the attached bathrooms. To keep with the ethos of the location, the villa is very eco-friendly with no use of plastic at all.Even in the bathroom the toiletries are in pottery containers. The concept of open bathroom follows the typical Balinese tradition. All the 4 rooms face a beautiful pool. The Buddy's bar was further up a few steps from the rooms....and the view of the forest and small paddy fields was AMAZZZING....!!!!
The ingredients used for cooking are organic. Food is served in a huge room open on two sides and facing the pool and never did we use the fans because there was nice breeze all day.
There is shuttle which takes you to Ubud market and picks you back at specific times.That was a great plus.
The environment is calm and serene and all you can hear during the day is chirping of birds. While there is a lot you can do in Ubud, but next time I am there I would want to spend at least two full days just enjoying and relaxing in the property. I thought Bali would be a one time visit, but this property is coaxing me to plan another holiday there.
You can't miss this opportunity if you are in Bali.
title: Beautiful Experince

text: We stayed here for 3 nights. There are four villas but we were the only ones there. So were lucky enough to have this haven to ourselves! Although all mod cons are available (tv and wifi) the very special environment made us switch off from modern society. The staff were superb and take such care and pride of the villas and grounds.  The shuttle into ubud was very convenient too. Didn't want to leave! Will definitely recommend and will return.
title: Heaven

text:
I love the fact that this villa was surrounded by trees and padi fields. The bedroom was huge even for a family, I asked a couple of extra beds for our kids and it turned out they were neatly fixed with a mosquito net which was very thoughtful. A nice outdoor bathroom, and the pool was just few steps away from the bedroom. 
Even though there were other guests in the villa, we still had our privacy since the common area were spacious, it was really good especially for the kids.
The staffs were very helpful and friendly, they had a shuttle car which could drop us to central Ubud every a couple hours. The breakfast set menu had many options and they were delicious.The downside was the internet was not working well, but it was not a big issue since we were on holiday. In the nutshell, it was a great holiday experience. Would love to come back soon!
title: An ideal place to relax with our family

text:
A most amazing stay

We reached Pandawas Villas late afternoon - the refreshing relaxing ambience and the chilled local welcome drink was just what we needed. 

After a swim in the indulgent pool - we took the complimentary shuttle service to Ubud market. The dinner meal was fresh and well presented. Guests can sit in the entertainment room - also called Krishna room - and watch your favorite shows. 

The bedrooms are spacious and beautifully decorated. So much care has been taken to make guests feel welcome. The world plugs are there in every corner of the room. The mattresses and pillows were very comfortable,  I had an amazing sleep. Awoke in the morning feeling so fresh. 

Thank you Pandawas Team for making my stay so memorable. I shall definitely come back
title: Sublime stay

text:
Great property - amazing surroundings, close to action. Well appointed rooms with european-like standards - spacious with high quality of fitouts and fit + finish. 
If you are in a small group of friends, say, 2-3 families with children and looking for something in Ubud - this is the place! Functional kitchen and a bar add up to giving you everything that one would need for a short stay - a home away from home - just have to experience it!
title: Experience Bali - the Ubud way!

text: This place is amazing. The villa is unlike your standard hotel, it have less than half a dozen rooms which means the service is very personalized and the place is very quite & private. The room is huge and have plenty to offer. Highly recommended for families, groups or even just couples who want to find a secluded place. The villa is very value for money for the standard of service and experience. Location is quite ideal. If you're looking for a gate away, far from the commotion of Bali, privacy, value for money and high standard of quality.. this is the place to go to. Two thumbs up!
title: quitet, peaceful, yet not boring.

text:
A Beautiful little place. Travelled there as 2 adults and 2 kids, 3 year old and 7 month old. It was a very friendly and homely atmosphere and the staff were very accommodating. Breakfasts were well prepared and flavoursome, and well sized. The location for us was great as it's not actually in ubud centre, which means you're away from the noise and crowds of the centre,  but this might not suit all. Saying that, they provide a free shuttle service several times a day to make sure that you are not missing out on anything; it's acgually quite close to the centre. 

The rooms are big and clean,  and the bathroom is quite interesting and exciting. They provided us with a baby cot, which was in good working order, and it was free of charge. The kids playroom is well stocked, and our eldest enjoyed feeding the fish. The pool is really nice, and suitable for adults and children. 

We loved this place and wouldn't hesitate in returning or reccommending.

Thank you Pandawas Villas, and thank you to the staff for making our stay enjoyable.
