text:
We had a wonderful time in Pandawas, the hotel is unbelievably nice, the tasteful interior, the beautiful hillside location within palm-, bananatrees and frangipani, the pool!! Perfect relaxation after busy sightseeing and heavy traffic in Ubud. Staff is so friendly and nice, food absolutely recommendable.
We would love to come again one day.
Thanks for all!
title: Paradise

text: Serenity, comfort, rejuvenating, not enough words to describe this beautiful place. This was probably me and my family's 3rd or 4th stay at Pandawas. The bedrooms, well maintained, spacious, enough to fit a family of four. You can't  help but loose track of time in its peaceful surrounding. It gives you a back to nature feel with its lush greenery, pond filled fishes and not to forget the outdoor activities your kids could do, including the outdoor pool and fun filled activities such as riding on the ATV which the staff gladly organized for us, The food so fresh and yummy, my special favorites are their croissants and the chocolate flavor gelato ice cream. With such pleasant staff members the service we had was great. No complains, Its one destination my family and I visit every time we are in Bali. Until we meet again kudos Pandawas.
title: An Experience truly worth experiencing

text: If you, like us, prefer boutique and unique places to stay that deliver something different from the standard resort experience, then we highly recommend Pandawas. Its almost like a private villa with staff on hand so you don't have to lift a finger. At times during our 10 night stay we were the only guests and had the place all to ourselves. The villa is very well considered and very child friendly, unlike other Ubud resorts. The owner also has a young child. Our two year old was in her element and all the staff adored her, showering her with attention and watching over her for us so we could read books and relax. The grounds are stunning with multiple Koi ponds and places to explore. A highlight was breakfast on top of the tower overlooking the rice paddies each day. We also loved the huge copper outdoor bath and most nights the whole family would lie in it under the stars. Food was good but a little repetitive after 10 nights but for a shorter stay it would be great. Free meals for kids under 3 was a welcome bonus. Meals were made to order when we wanted which adds to the home away from home feel. We only ventured out on a few occasions for dinner as believe me, you will want to savour every moment at Pandawas! Thanks to the owners, who were here for a few days, for making us feel so welcome and for the care and attention to detail they take to make the place so special.
title: Pure bliss, with a twist

text: This place is combination of luxury, exotic and peaceful experience. If there would be a above 5 ratings, I would do so. This place is very close to real shopping experience of where art is created. Our kids enjoyed very much in large swimming pool at the property. The spacious villas are  very well maintained and beautifully decorated. There is no doubt in our mind that we would be staying at Pandawas Villas for our next stay to Bali.
title: Exceptional experience and care

text:
I recently stayed 10 nights at pandawas villas and it was amazing!
We booked one villa for the four of us (2 adults 2 children) as they were full and we were expecting it to be crowded but it was any thing but!!!! Although the children had matresses on the floor they were very comfy and they did not mind.
The pool!!!!!! Wow we spent hours swimming with the kids and after they went to bed my husband and I could relax with our drinks overlooking the lush rainforest.
The service was impeccable and the food was delicious.
You would never know that the hotel was "full" it was so quiet!!!
The staff organized wonderful activities for us like the mountain bike ride through the village, the amazing massages by the local girls and the wonderful babysitter to look after the kids while we had dinner in the village.
We will definatly be back soon
title: HEAVEN

text: This is my second stay at the Pandawas and the experience is only better than even the first.... Food continues to be great, staff is cheerful and helpful and of course the location and the villas enthrall you. My son loves the setting : variety of games indoor  and for outdoor  a lot of open space with activities like swimming, gardening, kite flying. The staff is attentive and smart to be vigilant yet non interfering. Kids love it :)  We got good recommendations on places to visit and restaurants to eat in. A must do for a family, if you get the chance.
title: Simply my favorite

text:
Short family holiday to SE Asia took in this gorgeous ecofriendly resort in Bali. Only 4 villas around a large clean pool, we stayed at "Bhima". All the villas are named after the brothers from the Mahabharat, and in fact this was the central theme for the whole resort.
Right from the booking process with owner/manager Monika, to the pickup from the airport, the individually cooked meals, to the friendly staff towards the children, we had an amazing time.
The rooms have been completed to a very high standard and the outdoor bathroom was a pleasant exprience!
Would love to return sometime.
title: Fantastic, amazing hidden gem in the centre of Bali at Ubud, superb service and everything ecofriendly.

photos.caption: villas as seen from Buddy's bar
Fresco paintings above main entrance porch.

text: My family and I visited Ubud for the first time recently and we were very impressed with Pandawas Villas.  This exclusively luxurious property scored full marks from us!!  The villa was beautifully furbished on beautiful manicured  grounds overlooking a rice paddy.  Every morning we had breakfast on the terrance overlooking the paddy.  The service staff were extremely attentive and very helpful.  Definitely worth coming back for!
title: luxurious getaway!
Outstanding

text: I had heard of Pandawas by a friend and chose to stay there for our 3 nights in Ubud with family. Having been told about it, I did expect a beautiful venue, but no word could actually fully describe this realization. The amount of work and planning that made possible the creation of this place in the middle of what was probably once only field and jungle is just grand. Pandawas Villas is a truly beautiful environment, tastefully decorated with an attention to detail that is amazing. From the very basics (for ex: every waste basket in our villa being unique and beautiful items), to the totally unexpected (ability to plug in an ipod under the gazebo overlooking the rice fields), spacious private space, quality bedding and discreet service, this is a gem of a place and one can immediately see it has been conceived with heart and soul. A unique experience
title: Absolutely beautiful

text: My husband and I needed some relaxation and time to ourselves, so we decided to make another trip to Pandawas.  Our days were relaxing and we felt restored at the end of our stay.  The staff of Pandawas were very accommodating and helpful.  Thank you for a worry-free and much needed holiday!!
title: Our second stay was even better!

photos.caption: we ate breakfast everyday by the koi pond

text:
Our stay at the Pandawas Villas was the most awesome experience. The place is so tranquil, and peaceful ..... so beautifully done up ..... spacious rooms ...... comfortable extra bedding for the kids ..... absolutely child friendly ....... extremely helpful staff .... excellent food ...... and of course the gracious host and hostess .... Arvind and Monica .... who took every little care to make our stay even more comfortable ..... Infact we  cut down on a day's sightseeing just to be able to spend a day at the Pandawas. 
Need I say more .....!!!
title: Serenity in the Jungle

text: My stay at the Pandawas Villas far exceeded my expectations in every way possible.  From being greeted at the airport with a cool face towel and a cold beverage, to the incredible freshly prepared meals each day, to the unbelievable hospitality, friendliness and kindness of the Villa staff, I was treated like a queen the entire time.  For those that are looking for a true cultural "treat", I would highly recommend this place.  Nestled in the hills amongst the rice fields, this was a perfect place to relax and rejuvinate.  The rooms were elegant but simple, the bathroom and copper tub was truly unique.  For those who truly appreciate the finer things in life, this place is truly an experience in the devine.  A very special place.
title: Absolute Paradise

text:
We stayed at Pandawas Villas with our 3-months old son, and had a truly fantastic time. The staff went out of their way to accommodate our needs, which included sterilising baby bottles etc. The grounds and the four villas are just beautiful, surrounded by tranquil scenery, and just 10 mins out of Ubud it is the perfect location.

We will definitely recommend Pandawas to our friends, and hope to return soon.
title: Perfect

text:
We spent 5 nights at Pandawas on the recommendation of a freind and it delivered everything that we wished for and more.  There are just four villas around the pool each of which provides spacious and comfortable accommodation with a wow factor built in.  There are extensive grounds on the property and a number of intimate locations where you can take breakfast or dinner.  Overall the property has been carefully designed to engender a feeling of tranquility, it would be very hard indeed not to relax completely here.

The staff are very freindly and helpful, I had the impression that it really mattered to them that you got just what you wanted.  We only took dinner in the hotel once but on that occasion we were impressed with the simple and good food served, the ingredients for which were sourced from the market that day. 

I'd give this place the highest recommendation, one of the top half dozen places I have stayed.
title: A luxurious peaceful oasis

text:
From the moment we arrived at the airport we were amazed right on time the driver (one of the staff :)) was there to take us on our 1 and a half our trip to ubud even though it was 1am. When we arrived i was amazed! we could not see much as it was so dark but the lights that lined the pathway were lined with flowers. We were then given DELICIOUS welcome drinks and shown to our room which was fantastic, there was a beautiful king size bed with patterened batik and two comfy single beds for the kids. when we woke up the next morning the view from our villa was spectacular. imagine opening the door and sitting on the porch overlooking the rainforest and tranquil infinity edge pool while the sun is rising. The next few days were some of the most relaxing days i've ever had. Some days we stayed at the villa and just chilled in the pool or had a massage other days we went on elephant safari's and bike rided through local villages.
 So thank you pandawas villa's we will be back soon!!!!!!
title: THE TRIP OF A LIFETIME!!!!!!!!

text:
I stayed at this property from 17th March to 20th March, and was with colleagues and clients. The property is well appointed with just 4 beautiful large amazing villas! We had 3 out of the 4 villas for ourselves so almost the entire property was ours. It is set on 2 acres of land with lush landscaped gardens! Water features, koi pond, gardens, buddy's bar, Arjuna bar and more! Food was organic and freshly prepared!

Each and every room is unique and has different theme to it - inspired from the Hindu Epic Mahabharta!

We would love to return back to this property again and again! Highly recommended for business, leisure and even just a family getaway!

Service of the staff was immaculate! We love Bali and we love Pandawas!
title: One of the Best Properties I have Stayed ever!

text: We went back to the Pandawas - this time, with my parents.  We stayed there for 3 days and wished it was longer.  We got great suggestions about tours for our interests.  All the rooms are very spacious and well decorated.  Kids had a blast - custom menus, toys in the pool and activities to keep them engaged - kite flying, gardening, fish feeding and an entertainment room.  It was my parents first visit to Bali and the underlying research around the Pandavas from Mahabharata epic was fully cherished.  Their comments in the guest book says it all - this (re)visit was beyond perfection!!
title: Beyond perfection!!!

text:
This is a perfect location for a family with young children.  The playroom is well equipped with toys (the owners have young children).  The staff soon know the children's names and address them by this during the stay, fussing over them and making them feel very special. The kitchen accomodated our off menu requests for childs meals.  They arranged for my daughter to be dressed in local costum with full flower and golden crown headress which she loved.

For the parents the villa is total 5 star luxury without the snootyness that equivalent hotels include.  The very spacious rooms and common area are beautiful; a combination of tasteful design and carefully selected ornaments/paintings. 

The pool is a good size with overhanging trees dropping yellow and white flowers into the water and lined on one side with banana trees.  Two smaller childrens pool areas are part of the overall pool.

The bar overlooking the surrounding paddy fields is a perfect spot to unwind at the of the day.

Villa Pandawas is laid out following the rules of balinese designs with temple in the north east corner and sleeping areas east and west.  As you enter the walled villa compound you immediately feel at peace.

On the final day the staf invited us to join them for morning prayers in the villa temple which was very special and something we will always remember.

The staff makes this an incredible place to stay and I highly recommend this villa to anyone.
title: Fantastic villa for family with young children

text:
We recently spent three nights at Pandawas Villas – and it was a truly unforgettable moment. The attention to detail is first class. From the first greeting we had at reception, the architecture of the villa – which is beautifully designed and decorated, the room setting with amazingly sound system, the organic toiletries, the entertainment system that kept our son occupied, till to our farewell, it exceeded all our expectations. 
This is not “just” a villa. This is more like living in your very good friend’s private and exclusive home sweet home with all the luxuries he can offer you, added with relaxing environment that gives you peaceful mind at a different level. 
I will take back home with me the amazing time we had here and when times are tough let the memory of this wonderful place wash over me and put life in perspective. 
Big thankyou Pandawas and your fantastic staff for a time we will always remember. 
(Herrie. Lauren. Olajuan).
title: Relaxation at a different level...

text: We stayed at Pandawas for 11 nights in January/February 2011 and the time passed all too quickly.  The staff (all 30 of them) were wonderfully friendly and thoughtful.  We were there on the first anniversary of their opening on January 29th and were delighted to share in a small ceremony with the staff to celebrate this.  We were presented with a cake on our own anniversary and had a great tour around some of the local villages with two of the staff on their motorbikes.  The food was great and the chef very happily responded to specific meal requests.  The villas were well-equipped, roomy and comfortable.  The free wireless internet worked well.  The location is quiet and peaceful but only about 15 minutes from Ubud with all its restaurants and galleries.  Pandawas is a 5 Star resort in every respect.
title: Wonderful place

text: We just returned from a truly memorable vacation - made so by the exceptional stay we had at pandawas, by far the most stunning property we have ever stayed in. The setting is heavenly and the service surpasses all your expectations. The staff went out of their way to make sure our stay was comfortable. I especially fell in love with the architecture of the villa, it is beautifully decorated, showcasing the best of Bali. Everything, and yes everything, from the food to the toiletries to even the mosquito repellant is organic!! It was also perfectly located to explore the hustle bustle of cultural ubud with the centre of the city less than ten minutes away. The attention to detail was unlike anything I have seen before - there was a bottle sterilizer, bottle drying rack in addition to the baby cot for our nine month old. The staff even babysat her while we enjoyed the sumptuous breakfast outdoors at Buddy's bar with a view of the lush paddy fields! I was told that they are soon going to start selling some of their products online, I cant wait!! Oh, dont forget to ask the staff for restaurant recommendations, we loved every bit of what we tried. Dream vacation - Big thank you Pandawas!
title: I checked into paradise!

text:
We stayed here the week of Jan 3, 2011 with little kids and their grandmother.  We have lived and traveled all over the world and this place is truly amazing!  The rooms, facilities, food, staff, were outstanding.  This place is away from the city center but the car service worked great for us when we wanted to shop or eat in the city (but mostly ate at the hotel restaurant as they will cook pretty much anything you want!).  Very upscale and relaxing environment with just some amazing luxurious features.  Really not a "hotel" experience, more like living in someone's very exclusive personal home with all the luxuries you can imagine. 
- Traveler recently relocated to Singapore from the US.
title: Absolutely amazing experience!

text: Pandawas is everything we expected - and more!  The villas are wonderfully designed, and luxuriously appointed!  The location is great for unwinding and relaxation.  We had the misfortune of having bad weather conditions the entire time of our stay (3nights), and it was indeed a blessing that Pandawas is a lovely place to hole-up in!  The entertainment system kept my teenagers occupied, while the playroom kept my 6yr old busy!  Bad weather also meant dining in, and it was again a pleasure that the food was great!  Most importantly, the staff are wonderful!  They are most helpful, yet discreet.  You can't help feeling that the place is your own private property!  If you are looking for a great place to unwind and relax, this is the place to be!  And don't miss the massage in an open pavillion near the pool!  Being serenaded by cicadas is also a bonus!
title: Great Boutique Hotel/Villa in a lovely location!

text:
This was our first visit to Bali and we spent 4 nights at the Pandawas in Ubud.  about 15 mins from the main Ubud Centre this place was paradise!  Set away from the crowds with lush green cover all around, this was a perfect setting for a very relaxing holiday.  Pandawas is everything the photos depict and much more.  Named after the 5 Pandawa brothers from the epic Mahabarata, the rooms have been planned with meticulous detailing.  The bathrooms are pieces of art!! The copper bath tub is open to the sky, and it comes stocked with toiletries!

The pool is amazing and clean, and the kids room is very well stocked with toys, games, books and DVDs, My 2 children aged 7 and 3, did not want to leave the villa!! The staff are amazingly warm and helped us plan out itineray that were child friendly!!!!! The food was delicious and is made fresh, so orders need to be placed in advance. They have their own small kitchen garden and herbs corner, from which they source most of their kitchen requirements.  The bread is made fresh every morning and I would recommend their bread basket to everyone staying there!! 

There is a small temple within the villa, and offerings are made every morning.  The buddies bar is another highlight and should not be missed. 

Thanks to the warmth showed by the owner, Mrs. Monica and her wonderful staff, especially Nita and Kedai, my family and I had a wonderful holiday in Bali!
title: Stunning Villa is beautiful Bali!

text:
Pandawas Villas is one of the most wonderfully secret retreats you could wish to find in a lifetime.  I spent three days there with my wife, and I doubt we shall ever experience such a wonderful and relaxing place again in our lives - unless we return!
It's difficult to know what to praise most.  Surrounded by the tranquility of nature, each of the four villas - yes, just four - share undreamt-of private and shared spaces, all in the traditional Balinese architectural style with high ceilings that makes the climate most pleasant. 
The service is impeccable, discreet and always available;  there is no pressure of having to get to breakfast by 10am, as you can have anything you wish, prepared or cooked to order, whenever you like.  The luxury of this lack of pressure of time is incalculable.
We wanted to retreat in order to relax, but also to think creatively.  Our busy minds found no difficulty in continuing to function effectively without distraction, so our creative thinking was not compromised.  But when it came to relaxing, all our ambitions to leave the villas to explore the island.... somehow just didn't seem necessary, or more important than just staying around in the spacious grounds, relaxing, or swimming in the magnificent infinity pool.
It obviously comes at a price.  But if time and relaxation are at a premium for you, this could be one of the most inspired and memorable choices you could make.
title: If Bali is paradise to the world, then this is paradise to Bali

text: The Pandawas villas are as spectacular in real life as they are in the online brochures; no disappointment at all. Nestled amongst the birdlife and jungle-green of outer-ubud (10-15 mins away from centre), the villas couldn't have been a more perfect change of pace and scene for our family of 2 young children plus 'grandma'. The pool was a perfectly designed space for the children and adults alike, the suites were spacious, air-conditioned and with proper, high-quality mattresses, even the kids' beds were of superior quality! The bathrooms are just like in the photos; one of my favourite spots of the villas in fact. And the best, best part was the warm, family-like nature of each of the staff. Each of them were so gentle, generous and kind with such an easy manner with the children. I would look forward to seeing each of them after a day outside; it truly was a pleasure to return to the embracing arms of the villa and the staff. Highlight was motorbiking with some of the staff through the neigbouring rice paddies and local villages. I will definitely come again; already can't wait.
title: PERFECT FAMILY OASIS AMONG THE LUSH FOREST WITH WARM WEATHER AND EVEN WARMER STAFF!

text: Our recent stay(1st week of august) at Pandawas Villas was refreshingly pleasant experience and both me and my wife instantly felt that this is a per fact place for our holidays. It provides all modern and top class amenities and yet its picturesque location and layout is in complete harmony with the beautiful natural surroundings.Staff of apandawas Villas is highly courteous and skilled and refer service with a smile. Stay at pandawas  was a wonderful,soothing and rejuvenating exprience. The entire layout,decor and furnishing of Lounge,Dinning area,majestic Bedrooms and well maintained swimming pool , Fish and lily ponds,Bar,Entertainmertarea and it's ambience makes the Ideal place for stay.
title: Perfact destination for rejuvenating vacation/holidays

text:
We spent a wonderful few days at Pandawas when it was newly opened.  Everything was to a very high standard and it was an experience I hope we will repeat again.  
We cannot recommend it highly enough.  From the attentiveness of the staff, the high standard and variety of cuisine, to the cleanliness and general peacefulness of this lovely place it is simply paradise on earth.  It is the perfect venue for honeymooning, family celebrations, or just as a relaxing place to chill out.  When we first arrived we intended to go out and visit as much of Bali as we could, but the plan soon changed as we simply relaxed and enjoyed being this delightful haven.
title: Staying at Pandawas, Ubud

text: We stayed for 6 nights in the pandawas villas with our 3 kids (19, 12 14) We had 2 villas,  Our whole family loved it! Beautifull complete rooms with superior bedlinen and towels, fantastic pool, super view and very kind personel. We definetly come back to this heaven in Ubud!!
title: Heaven in Ubud

text:
Rita & Atul....Canada
Pandawas Villas...A truly amazing experience from the moment you walk through the doors.  The luxurious villas are nestled amongst the natural greenery of the rice fields, the staff take great care and attention and the food was delicious. In particular we remember the coconut/lime drinks sitting by the bar, taking in the lovely view. My husband and I had a wonderful 4 days stay in June 2010.  It was like being taken care of by friends, we left feeling relaxed and throughly spoiled.
title: Home away from Home

text:
My family and friends consider me a "road warrior" and having travelled to exotic destinations PANDAWAS is a truly unique home.

Service is endless and attention to details such as a wake up with freshly brewed coffee and a friendly smile.

Villa is total service -- daughter played in game room with board games while MOM had 4 hands massage and DAD used internet.

Food and drink are to be compared with Worlds finest -- organic veggies and single malt.
Architecture of buildings is unique -- natural pool, Buddy"s Bar, Temple and Koi ponds all add to a truly relaxing experience. Imagine a bath or shower in an outdoor bathroom linking you with MOTHER NATURE.

My family and I asked staff for local tips about shopping and sightseeing and were escorted to stores. My daughter and I took bike tour in the mountains which I strongly suggest as a family event.

We will quietly spread the WORD on Pandawas to friends. It is truly magical and a unique Villa
title: Over The Top!!

text: We went to Pandawas with family and it was really an incredible time. The lush property set in a valley like setting,  is an amazing place to relax in. To top it all the staff is absolutely one of the best making it a sure shot relaxing holiday when you are traveling with kids. My son had a great time with all the toys at his disposal and always someone to play with him:) Wish the holiday could have been extended:) Wonderful place for a family who want to relax in a luxurious environment...
title: Awesome!!

text:
If you enjoy the sounds of nature, 5 star service and incredible architecture then Pandawas is a fabulous choice of hotel. The staff was outstanding; the pool is built right up to the jungle and the outdoor bathrooms are truly one of a kind. My husband and I  celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary on July 27th. A member of the hotel staff performed a traditional Balinese ceremony in the on-site temple. It was so special for us. 
My children played in the game room (play station and games) while we had a couples massage. This is one of the best properties in the world-truly! There are iPod stations in the rooms and surround sound speakers. They provided organic soaps, organic scrubs, and organic mosquito spray made especially for Pandawas. We hired a driver from their staff each day who drove us around Ubud. This hotel is better than any other in Ubud.
title: A visit to paradise!

text: The resort gave us a traditional Balinese welcome . The staff is very helpful and co operative. The ambiance at night time with the insects twittering and special lighting is superb. Location among paddy fields surrounded by pine tree  is perfect.
title: Its heaven on Earth

text:
We visited Pandawas Villas during the Easter break with two kids. The villas are beautiful and very tastefully done up. Certainly has the WOW factor! Every detail of the villa from the ceiling art to servingware has been meticulously thought of. The best feature for us, was the open reception / dining area. 

We were surrounded by greenery and water and with a cocktail in hand...that’s pretty much holiday perfection!   We enjoyed the food immensely. The buffets offered us the best flavours of Bali and Indonesia. The kids were happy with the toys and painting but their favourite pastime was feeding the fish with the staff.   The staff was very friendly, helpful and willing to go out of the way to help. They make excellent baby sitters too!  

Overall, highly recommended to anyone who wants a luxurious stay in Ubud, Bali.
title: we were spoilt...

text:
As soon as you reach the place you will love the place with its beautiful lush
SURROUNDINGS , Lovely  green trees and a beautiful open swimming pool .  You can relax outside and let the surrounding seep thru you.. Very spaced out and Peaceful ,  Perfect place to get away from it all. Great service , great staff .  Beautiful clean rooms with equally lovely open bathrooms.  The place is wonderfully designed with comfortable surroundings LOVELY EXPERIENCE . A  place any body would want to keep coming back to. it is very special, spacious and enjoyable.
title: Simply Perfect,Peaceful,Exciting Enjoyed Every Moment.

text:
Simply the best place we have ever been. Perfect place to relax, very frienly staff and delicious food.
Our daughters - 3 and 18 years - both enjoyed very much too, so we can highly recommend Pandawas Villas to everybody seeking a peaceful and relaxing atmosphere.
Per Enevoldsen
title: Perfect place to relax

text: Pandawas is a luxury premium resort in Ubud area in Bali and is independently managed.  We stayed at the villa with my wife's parents, 2 young children and a nanny -- we had the entire property for ourselves for 4 nights!!!  Due to its stunning architectural design and decor, Pandawas took us back in time and left us thoroughly delighted.  With an expansive pool, large rooms, unique layout -- made it a 'gem' of a resort, the perfect home for a perfect vacation.  The amenities (music system, WiFi, flat screen TVs, a full media entertainment room for kids activities) made our stay very enjoyable.  This was so much in contrast to any hotel experience we have had.  The food menu was 'customized' to our choice and everything was prepared 'fresh'.  The incredibly friendly staff showed personal care in every aspect of our stay.  This was certainly THE place to detox completely and simply chill!!
title: JUST CHILL!!!

text:
From the moment the van reaches the boundary of the Pandawas property, the atmosphere  changes from one of weariness (from the long trip) to one of excitement coupled with serenity. You feel that sense of arrival which simply releases all the burdens of the mortal world. You transform into royalty, with the level of service accorded, the vast spaces of the villas and the tranquil pool side hugged by the surrounding forest. Here in the mountains of Ubud, you are in the ultimate realm which makes one feel almost godlike. 

It's hard to leave Pandawas and face reality again.

Thanks for the surreal experience!!!!
title: Pandawas moment!!!

text:
Everything was PERFECT! The rooms were spacious and immaculate. Staff was friendly, always smiling and ready to be of service. Food was divine and portions were large. (must try the avocado salad)

CAN"T WAIT TO GO BACK!!!!
title: BAGUS SEKALI

text: Set atop a mountain surrounded with plush greenery, Pandawas Villas provide total relaxation for anyone seeking respite from city life.  Serenity, solitude and service are words that perfectly describe what my friends and I experienced at the resort.  In fact, we had the resort all to ourselves!  With only 4 beautifully-furnished villas for guests, we got the privacy we needed.  The minute we walked into the resort’s receiving area, we were given cold towels and welcome drinks which were surprising treats especially after a long drive.  But the surprise did not end there, we were awed not only by the elegant, minimalist furnishings at the main common area but also by the wide open space right before us – high ceiling and no walls which afforded us with the perfect view of the pool and greenery which we lack in the city.  The villas were very grand and impressive with very nice color motifs and furnishings.  There was just so much space and yet the atmosphere was so much like home!  A where you have a pond just outside your room/villa, an entertainment room, a stylish bar, a nice relaxing pool, and a hilltop hut where you can enjoy starry evenings.  Of course, Pandawas wouldn’t be “home” without its friendly, professional and very efficient staff.  In fact, everything we requested for were given and arranged for us, including a birthday cake for our friend who celebrated his birthday at the resort.  Not to be outdone by any other resort, the food was amazingly delicious!  The best Balinese dishes I’ve ever tasted.  We always had a feast prepared for us.  It’s home away from home.
title: A home away from home

text:
Walking into the property was the most stunning experience. The beauty and ambience of the resort was magical. The room was huge with a beautiful bed, amazing bathroom and decor and all the mod cons. The staff were friendly and helpful. The food was the best I have had in Bali. The swimming pool was so beautiful and the lights around it at night with the magniicent surroundings wa breathtaking. A memory I will have with me for ever. I felt so spoilt!

Karen
title: Heavenly

text:
There's only one word to describe how I feel whenever I'm at Pandawas ..... Heaven! 

The first time I was at Pandawas, I was with my husband and my 3 boys.  I am so glad that the staff helped us take care of our children.  The place is just perfect for relaxation, very private and very peaceful.  I was able to de stress even though I was with my 3 kids!!!  Service was really good.  Food was superb from breakfast to dinner. But what I truly crave for is the non traditional pancakes in the morning, with fresh fruits and the refreshing watermelon juice. The rooms are enormous, beautiful, very well designed, with state of the art entertainment system,  I was totally bewitched by this place.  
I went back to Pandawas with my husband and friends.  Love is truly lovelier the 2nd time around. I became more in love with this place! I just can't stop admiring it's beauty and peacefulness.  A perfect place for a romantic getaway, to relax,  to have a good and quality time with family and friends,  ... Truly, Pandawas is -- Heaven on Earth...
title: Heaven on Earth

text:
Execellent settings - great views! Whether it is the sunny morning or the clouds are at play, each view is more spectacular than the other.
The rooms are very tastefully done and carefully thought thru.
Great stuff to have a lounge / entertainment room separate with a wonderful sound system and great for watching movies or playing games.
The bar which was on a perch was absolutely fantastic according to me. Great place to unwind, have a drink and watch the moon light in the open.
Staff were extremely user friendly but then that is typical of balinese culture.
Overall a very luxurious and relaxing experience.
title: Pampered in Luxury + User friendly service + Breath taking views!!!

text: My husband and I spent Chinese New Year at the Villas-a MUCH needed de-stressing for both of us!  We were pampered and treated with gentle, friendly care from the minute we were picked up from the airport until we were dropped off again 4 days later.   We really just wanted to relax and have no set schedule for anything, and the staff really did a superb job of being there whenever WE needed them.  Ubud is just a quick ride away and is a great place to soak in the culture of Bali.  We also did a day trip around Bali to take in the sights, but mostly we just lounged at the Villas and enjoyed the pool and gorgeous sunsets.  The staff was very accommodating;  we enjoyed the delicious, freshly prepared food and cocktails during the entire stay.  I can't wait to go back and get another poolside massage, enjoy the beautiful outdoor soaking tubs, and do some Yoga!
title: perfect place to relax in Bali

text:
My journey with Ayurvedagram began in 2014 after having health issues and it was a trip that changed changed my life in many ways. Since then I have come to Ayurvedagram many times to experience the wonderness that it has to provide. Ayurvedagram was pivotal in my journey to improved health and well being and is a place very close to my heart. 

I was so excited to hear that Ayurvedagram was coming to Bali and came as soon as I could. The experience which I have had here has been wholesome and enlightening. 

Set in the beautiful and spiritual Ubud, the grounds are beautiful, serene, peaceful and there is a spiritual ambiance that welcomes you as you arrive. 

The beauty of Ayurvedagram here at Bali are not just its surroundings but the people and is also one of the reasons I was pulled to come here to Bali. The staff including Monica the founder ,Dr Natasha, the therapists, Yoga Master, Kitchen staff, receptionist and maintenance staff have been so welcoming, caring and kind and go beyond the call to make your wellness journey here a holistic experience. 

I have not only gained good wellbeing but knowledge and inspiration for better physical and mental health. Thank you to everyone here at Ayurvedagram Bali for their hospitality and I wish them all the best in bringing the principles of Ayurveda to many more guests in the years to come. 

I would highly recommend making a visit to Ayurvedagram Bali you will not regret it!
title: Ayurvedagram Bali is a Soulful Journey🌺🌴

kind regards

text: Fantastic stay at Ayurvedagram in Ubud. Beautiful suite looking onto the pool and forest with a very comfortable enormous bed. The treatments were amazing - authentic Ayurvedic massage and steam, by two experienced therapists, from India. Dr. Natasha the in residence highly trained Ayurvedic doctor did a professional and caring full health consultation. The food follows strict vegan Ayurvedic traditions using local homegrown  produce as one would expect in a Ayurvedic wellness and treatment centre. Do not expect typical hotel restaurant menu. Try the meditation with the rice paddy view - I just drifted off into deep relaxation. This is a place to seek genuine Ayurvedic treatment in Bali, it is a wellness centre for time out, reflection, yoga, meditation and self care.

text:
I have heard about Ayurveda treatments, but never experienced one before.. So, when I heard about Ayurvedagram Bali, I decided to go there and have a 5 day "test run".

A resort itself is Amazing. It is located just outside of Ubud in the quiet and peaceful area surrounded by a jungle. Accommodation choice varies between newly built Suites with shared swimming pools and villas with jungle views.

Aurveda program itself was really enjoyable and rejuvenating. A team of experienced professionals (a doctor, therapists etc.) were making sure that everything was running smoothly and all aspects taken care for. Typical daily program included 2 therapies, 3 Yoga/Meditation sessions, walking exercise and 3 healthy meals per day.

I enjoyed my visit so much, that I have already booked my next 14-day retreat :-) Highly recommended!

text:
Review for Pandawa Villas 

The experience of staying at the Pandava Villas( Ayurvedagram ) was miserable to say the least. We had given advance notice via our agent regarding the food and it’s in a remote location and there’s a child in the family, one person has a leg injury and one person has a heart problem, we were told food will be provided and there’s a menu and everything and you may order ala carte and upon reaching there, there were three items for breakfast, nothing for lunch, and two items for dinner for which you have to specially order at least 2 hours before and not even worth half their price. Whenever we found an issue, their excuse to everything to was, we just opened after 3 years. Their management is a joke, the staff was very friendly and helping us to the best of their ability, but having such an untrained management they could only do so much. 
The room service was acceptable but not worth paying this much money. 
They call themselves a 5 star hotel/resort but the services are below what you get in a 1 star hotel. They charge money you pay for a 7 star resort and give mediocre services. 
They have no car service and mind you the resort is on a slope and has a slopey road before also, on our first day we waited for 2 hours after placing order on the grabb app yet our order wasn’t confirmed as the location is in a remote place and we asked for a car and they said nobody is available. 
Now the nearest marketplace was 30 minutes away via car costing 100 dollars in coming and going return fare and that’s less than half the price of food we could’ve ordered. 
This is the first time in my life I’ve had to fight them to give us a couple of omelets and fried rice for dinner in a 5 star hotel for dinner because my sister (11y) hadn’t eaten anything in a couple of hours due to visa process at airport, 2.5 hours of traffics then checking in and then waiting another 2 hours figuring out how to get food. 
The worst experience at this resort, my personal suggestion is don’t even come to close to this resort.
title: Best worst experience at Ayurvedagram

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for your review. 

We are in the process of transition to an Ayurveda Wellness resort and we have informed that to your agent. 

This is a double review and we have reported you to tripadvisor. You and your spouse are delibrately defaming the property as you wanted more and more freebies and the team refused to you give you more things. Lets get the chronology correct:
1. you wanted heavy discounts from the room rate- you got that. 
2. your agent explained to you that only bed and breakfast can be offered. you agreed to that. 
3. you knew you will be offered only veg ayuveda food - you were ok with that. it was also going to be simple ayurveda food. you agreed to that. French fries are not part of any ayurveda menu. 
4. if you were so unhappy - you could have checked out after a few hours - you refused to. 
5. you wanted free free - we did offer you foot massage and shoulder massage - we also requested you to check out early with full refund if you were so unhappy as you only wanted non-veg food. you refused to check out. 
6. Distance is measured via google maps - i advice do download and check if a route has traffic or not. You were offered a taxi - you did not want to pay to the taxi people - maybe you should hire a bike. we do not run a taxi service where we can offer you free taxi - if you need a taxi you need to pay. 
7. If you do want more than current service by the team - as we told you many times during your stay - you are most welcome to check out and find a hotel who can understand your demands and complaints and give you all for free. 
8. Bali new year's time is peak season - i presume its the same in your country also - hence time taken will always be more if there is traffic. This should be basic understanding. 
9. Slope - this is Ubud - there are hills - now you are blaming the property because the road made by the government has a slope?  
10. Before we give replies to more of your lies and disrespect - leg injury and heart problem  - and no one at the property is actually aware of this - the team requested you to check out so many times as they were so tired of your rudeness. Why did you not check out early?  why did you complete your full stay ?  

Again we requested you many times to check out early. Its very sad for the team to have guests like yourself. 
We hope you are able to find a hotel where you get happiness and of course who can give you all services you demand at 50% dicounts. 

Thank you
kind regards
Management Team
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:

every time we don't find anything we have to call them, and one more thing they should start with fully fledged restaurant. So it will be more comfortable for guests because near by there is no restaurant so it becomes very difficult for guests,otherwise it's a good stay.

text:
Firstly leave 5 star this isn’t a  1 star hotel it’s just a Home stay- 
We booked 4 rooms - 1 luxury suite , 1 luxury terrace suite and 2 private swimming pool rooms - 
We arrived at the hotel 6.00pm , tired after long flights from india. Staff was very nice 

At the time check in we come to know that swimming pool rooms are not private pools it’s shared between 3-4 rooms. Fraud 1 

Then we asked about the dinner  , non veg which they isn’t available at the hotel , hell tired with kids , then they tell us they will prepare vegetarian food we said fine , at 8 pm they said they haven’t prepared the dinner as we were the only ones wanting dinner. 
While making the booking we had informed the Hotel owner/management Miss Monica Mohindra about our food requirements more than a month in advance we have confirmation for everything from her official email . Fraud 2 

Then with kids hungry we asked hotel to arrange vehicle etc so we can go for dinner outside even after being so tired - they said they can’t arrange - we had literally fight to get eggs and bread for dinner. 
They have mentioned it’s very near to restaurants is totally a lie - it’s a minimum 25- 30 mins drive and costs 70-100 dollars for a return fare. 
Next day I get a message from Monica , that we had already informed guests etc that they will not serve any lunch and dinner - nothing to eat even French fried weren’t available. Fraud 3 - so where to go for dinner. 

This is the worst property I have lived. Don’t even try thanks
title: Worst Hotel and management is just some frauds

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for taking the time to write the review. From the management:
1. there is no mention on any site anywhere that the property has private pools.
2.  we have already mentioned to all agents the property is mostly vegetarian  - as its in transition to Ayurveda wellness resort. We are however offering bed and breakfast - hence the 50% discount on the rates. You have booked and selected this option and on check in again this was informed. However we see your expectation despite the 50% discount on the rate was much much more. 
3. Defaming an employee name on a public site to hide your ill-manners to a team on the ground is highly disrespectful. Hence we have reported you to tripadvisor. 
4. The team told you - if you would like to order they can order dinner as delivery for you from an outside restaurant - or they can prepare a basic meal at the ayurveda kitchen or they can book a car to take you out to a restaurant. You insisted on a simple meal at the property after which you simply kept bad-mouthing the team. 
5. Balinese people are very nice people - if they remain quiet and respectful it does not mean they do not feel hurt at the tone and mannerism you kept using while on the property. 
6. Restaurants are in the range of 5-15 km radius. Its super peak season - we do not know about your country but here in Bali - on peak season there is immense traffic. You can always open google maps and check. We do not need to lie to you about travel time. 
7. Payment for any taxi  - is charge of the taxi. The property can only call a taxi - if you do not want to pay taxi fare on peak season - we are unable to asssit you further. You can always hire a bike. 
8. So a property serving guests is never a fraud - its people like you - who do not want to pay - you want discounts - after that you complain and are rude - and then you leave a poor review. 

A point you need to think about - if you were so unhappy why did you check in and continue to stay here? You should have checked out immediately - reported to your agent to talk to us. The main point is - you wanted a heavy discounted stay during peak season despite knowing the reasons for the discount and you use that to claim freebies. 

We do sincerely hope you find happiness in another property and you do not trouble other staff as much as you disrespected the team here. 

Thank you. 
with kindest regards
Management Team

text: Beautiful Property with a nice pool. The hotel staff was always nice and accommodating. Breakfast every morning was a huge plus. The massages we booked were also nice. text:
Looking forward to a relaxing time at the end of our travels having not been abroad since pandemic. We arrived at 11.30pm to our jungle abode lovely to hear the sounds of insects/toads etc we were shown to our (deluxe first floor room with terrace) room by night porter.
The room was fine having recently been refurbished this was evident as fridge had  not been "unpacked" or plugged in, protective celaphane still on television, safe not working and no coat hangers to hang clothes on! On the plus side bed was comfortable.
No welcome letter from hotel or information about breakfast which is usually customary to welcome guests.
Got telephoned around 8.30 to ask what we wanted for breakfast choice of omelette, 2 fried egg or pancake various fruit juices or fruit and tea or coffee  so breakfast was basic. It was served in the communal kitchen, in 3 days we were there it appeared we were the only couple to be having breakfast outwith the block booking. I informed the reception lady about the lack of information about the hotel, breakfast etc was not a good first impression to have. We walked to the infinity pool where we were informed by reception we don't have access to it as that part of hotel had been booked out at this  and we had no access to it.
When I asked about restaurant, bar and spa I was informed there was no bar as the hotel was quiet and informed that there was plenty of eating places in Central Ubud approx 20 min by taxi costing 70k each way. Not walkable in dark as no lighting and hotel at bottom of steep hill. Also the spa was not available because the group were utilising restaurant and spa.
These are all things that are advertised on various websites as being available at the hotel/villa. This is how we choose our accommodation by reading reviews and info. 
We decided to check out after 3 nights and find somewhere we could relax with a pool, bar and restaurant on site (which we thought we had at Pandawas) .
It was discussed with reception the night before leaving and felt there was no apology for .

This hotel was not for us!!
title: Not for us

owner_response.text:

text:
We had a lovely stay at this beautiful villa to celebrate a friend's 40th birthday. The rooms are beautiful, spacious and well designed. My favorite part was the beautiful bathroom.  Indoor/outdoor with a huge stone bathtub and rain shower. We stayed in a pool front room looking across the infinity pool towards the lush jungle. It's hard to believe it's just a few minutes from Central Ubud. The central lounge area is also a great place to relax, play games or enjoy a game of billiards. We were also very happy to see a small library stocked with kids books. 
Staff were friendly and very helpful. 
Defintely hoping to stay here again!
title: A beautiful place to stay with family and friends!

text:
I did little research, just liked the look of pandawa villas on the website. It’s truly awesome. Total seclusion total serenity and absolute care for the guest. By chance I was here utterly alone for three days, it was like being a deity. The place is simply beautiful, the facilities are awesome, and if you need something that’s not in house jump on the back of someone’s scooter and venture into ubud. With no agenda at all I did more in two days than I can begin to describe. 10th C temple walking distance, Gorgeous paddi field landscapes, I saw luwak coffee actually coming out of a civet’s bottom, and I saw a thousand egrets Comong in to roost at sunset as we rode along the road beneath them.

Truly awesome place. Don’t bring any of your personal mind problems with you - and if you do be prepared to have it wringed out of you.
title: Omg it’s just me and infinity pool monkey

Had a wonderful time during our stay at this hotel (or villa rather :-) ) 

Staff is superfriendly and helpful with all requests. Ifyou have breakfast included, you may choose from 3 different (Continental, american or English) and let them know your choice the night before. There are also a menu for lunch/dinner and is perfect when chilling at the pool/hotel area.

Was really pleased when I saw the in-room entertainment system, a 5.1 Marantz/Mordaunt-Short set-up.
Staff were engaging and polite, especially as I was trying my Indonesian on them!
Breakfast was multi choice, ordered the night before & filling. 
A free shuttle bus runs into town when requested for the best part of the day and early evening. 
Unsure if they do evening meals as we explored the options around us. 
Sadly it was cool and wet on & off during our stay so only mr. 14yo used the massive pool. 
If you're looking to unwind with a book or 2 this is the place!

text:
Pandawas Villas has given us the most pleasant and rarely found luxury of our time: peace and tranquility. Pandawas has only 4 and very spacious Indonesian villas facing an infinity pool and it is surrounded by a lush jungle. The room was tastefully furnished with Balinese style furniture and had a very unique large outdoor bathroom with a separate shower and a very large copper bathtub where you may well enjoy a relaxing bath under a tropical rain.
The staff is almost invisible and they keep the outdoor area always clean.
Breakfast was discretely brought to us and served at the table in the veranda just outside our villa's door.
Pandawas impressed us the moment we walked in its wonderful lobby area and from that moment it offered a unique sense of total peace. It's menu and offerings are essential and you are not surrounded by 50 staff like in other resorts in Bali and therefore you get total peace to relax and enjoy a good book and recharge your soul and batteries.
We are Thankful to the Pandawas staff for having given me, my wife and my 3 years old daughter, the opportunity to truly relax and enjoy the peace away from the rest of this noisy and busy world.
title: An Oasis of peaceful tranquility

text: Huge room, comfy beds, large chaise longue for 2, rare huge open air shower, boutique and personal.... I I love it! Haven't felt so relaxed in months just sitting around in the lobby overlooking the pool and listening to the calls of birds and crickets. Was woken up by loud croaks during a thunderstorm which added to the lovely experience!
title: A newfound favourite!

text:
Our drive to Ubud was fascinating, on arrival we were met by Ani and her beautiful smile, Wiyan gave us a welcoming drink with his amazing smile, we were taken to our Villa, so spacious and cool, five steps away from the pool we were full of smiles!
Wiyan No 2 helped us with a driver for a day Katut! Our very own Katut and Bali was at our beckoned call. We arrived at The elephant park, it was amazing, nearly took the attendant with me on my elephant, soo anxious but within minutes I was in my element getting to know Agon, she was beautiful, feeding her afterwards was a real experience as we took fruit from our breakfast we were given HUGE loving hugs from Agon and a baby elephant, sooo gorgeous, I will remember that always. Off to lunch at a restaurant the driver took too, it was fantastic, Next stop was the butterfly park a little diasapointing, we were expecting to be covered in butterflies but sadly not, but we were given an in depth lesson on the life of a butterfly by Katut No 2,.....very annoying to see kids try to grab the butterflies, some succeeded and eventuated in a quicker death for those that predominantly only lives a week. Off to Hot springs temple, this gave me goosebumps, you can opt to be blessed in the hot springs, remember to wear your bathers and take a towel. NeXT stop was the tiered rice fields, amazing walk up and up and up, had a very satisfying coconut drink and carried on, past donation points a plenty,...remember to take your small change, donations here are not voluntary. We managed to find a path down, to another 'donation point' remember you already pay for entry, anyhow had 1000 rupiah or 100,000 with us, we gave the 1000 he was not happy and aggressive but after paying entry and 'donating' our way around we ran out if small money. The last stop was to see a waterfall, after walking the rice fields, we couldn't do the steps down to the base, it would have been very cool in that water and should have taken bathers! So bathers, towel, and change is a requirement on these day trips. Decided against the monkey forest, Katut gave us the option, but we were tired, hot and needed a swim and drink. Guess what?.......that evening we had our own monkeys in the trees above us. Wiyan No 3 showed 'He man' how to open a coconut that He Man harvested in the grounds, resulted in yet another lovely coconut water. Ubud centre has a lot to offer, this time of year isn't too busy, and still quite hot, is it ever cool in Bali? Luuv Ubud!
title: Serene, magical relaxing Ubud

text: Really upscale and grand, neat 'n clean, ultra hygienic and private place with very reasonable $$$ to get the full value of your money. You can stay at some other big brand named hotels but where will you get an infinity pool opening to a lush green forest, ultra comfortable 'n clean 'n soft beds, "live life king-size" experience, fresh off the tree mangoes and other fresh fruit salads, smoothies, food cooked to perfection, private soothing massages, and a plethora of such peaceful experiences that can't be described in words. We, with out 3 kids aged 12/6/1 yr, stayed here and enjoyed each and every moment thoroughly and peacefully. The best part is that even though surrounded by forest, their infinity pool is very well maintained and very clean with fresh water being recycled throughout the day. You never get a feeling of "stale" as you would at any other place. Everything, starting from room, to beds, to pool, to food is all FFRREEESSHHHH and CCLLEEAANN.. From meditation to yoga to personal massages to kids care and play room.. they have everything on the charts... Their huge grand Arjuna bar has some exceptional collection of fine wines and other spirits. They even arranged for an early morning sight seeing with their driver and car (of course at an expense but that too very reasonable in $) who took us at beautiful scenic spots that can only be known to a local.

text:
This was my second visit to Bali. The first brings back great memories of the villa we stayed in, but this time round the memories are going be something else altogether. What we experienced at Pandawas is closest I have ever got to 'bliss', nirvana.
We, my husband and I stayed at Pandawas in the last week of July.  To Ubud, we had dedicated 5 days of our short 10 day break, and it was a tough call, not postponing our flight to Singapore. 

The Pandawas too perhaps would have contended I would say, for Wordsworth’s thoughts, when he was writing, 'I wish I had the time to stand and stare', had he been fortunate to experience it.

 'Pandawas' itself is poetry, - its Mahabharata inspired villa-rooms, the black limestone edged pool, its waters a soft trickle over the ledge into the lush greens of the valley below, the tea table outside my room, made out of a traditional musical drum, the paddy terraced, but a glance uphill, the colossal patio, its weathered flooring, the pure organic papaya juice as orange as the fish in the fish pond next to the Arjuna Bar, the finger licking Indonesian spread, the sound of the wilderness in the stillness of the night and the gentle humm of the birds faraway while being pampered to a traditional Balinese massage in the poolside spa bale.

So one really needs at least 4 days to experience the 'Pandawas poetry' alone and then think of stepping out to absorb some history and culture around the thriving hub of Ubud, just a stone's throw beyond.

The villa rooms 4 in number, all equally comfortable and awe inspiring exotic were interestingly named after characters from the Hindu epic Mahabharata - the Pandawa brothers ... Yudhishtra, Bhima, Sahdeva & Nakula while the bar I thought was most appropriately named after the most charismatic of theme, Arjuna.

Here I would like to add that this nirvana experience is owed not just to the Pandawas ambiance, but also to the overwhelmingly warm and hospitable staff. The ever smiling, eager to help Wayan, the driver, Kadek, Ani ... you all made my holiday beautiful. Interestingly when you order a fresh papaya juice, you have to be a little patient and you actually see a staff member run down to their farm in the small valley below, pick a ripe papaya n voila you have fresh organic juice on your table. 

I am definitely coming back for more, next time round with my son and friends and their families.

Jyoti Singh
title: the pandawas poetry

text:
These holiday villas just seem to fit the local environment and culture. The whole location has a positive energy which truly inspires. 

I highly recommend the food which is expertly prepared to local family recipes. I'd also like to make special mention of the staff who were without exception friendly, enthusiastic and a pleasure to deal with. 

No hesitation in recommending a stay here!
title: A place of true peace and tranquility

text:
It seems like every single facet of Pandawas is geared towards just one thing - to make you feel as comfortable, peaceful and relaxed as you possibly can.

It starts with Ibu Ani (the receptionist)'s welcoming smile as you walk in the door. And then you gradually take in everything else - the sounds of nature, the open lounge area, the infinity pool that looks out over a forest, the koi fish pond on the side... and you can feel the cares and worries (and the two-hour drive from downtown!) begin to fall away.

Next, you enter your vast bedroom (there are only four rooms in this boutique villa, which explains why there's been no compromise made on space). There's an amazingly soft  king-size bed, a sofa in front of a tv hooked up to a serious sound system, a huge semi-open air bath area, and you think 'ok, this is it, i'm not getting out of here again'.

When you do finally rouse yourself to explore further, you come across hidden gems - like the entertainment room, or a second bar area tucked away higher up on the property which gives you a great view of the rice fields next door.

If there's anything at all that could do with improvement, it's possibly the menu - choice is a bit limited. However, you do have the option of taking the complimentary shuttle car down to Ubud, if you wish.

All in all, this was the perfect end to our holiday. We left Pandawas with regret, but refreshed and rejuvenated. Next time, we're going to stay much, much longer!
title: Incredibly peaceful

text: Excellent boutique property, fantastic service.  the food was beyond what we expected, and the pool a great place to lounge around in.  Could have easily spent a few more nights here and will do so on our next visit.  Highly recommended
title: Excellent stay

text:
This place offered a most relaxing and fulfilling stay. Unforgettable.
Arriving late evening we were greeted by a quiet solitude and a warm welcome from the staff led by the smiling Kedet. The villas remind me of how the Pandawas would have felt in the solitude of their exile except ours is self imposed!
The tranquillity and joy it brings embraces you soon after you arrive. The vast open Arjuna lobby is a lounge cum bar cum dining room and reception. Its vast and has a lot of breeze blowing through it. The pool and the lush green valley beyond are so relaxing that i felt smiles emerging all day.
There are only 4 spacious villas and each is large well ordered and furnished. lots of cupboard space, TV and audio systems and nice lounge chairs make your room a competitor for your attention with the Arjuna Lobby. the rooms are named after the other 4 brothers among the Pandawas.
Even if the rooms are full there is so much space around that no one comes in each others way.
They have got convenient set menus but are willing to create meal options. The small and efficient staff adds so much value to the Villas...they are eager to please, anticipate request, are well informed and yet unobtrusive. Keep it up folks!
There is a large dining table made of a single piece of wood. it can accommodate 10 or more but the staff ensures privacy even om that When another family was eating there they set up another breakfast spot near the lobby pool and next to the game centre. it was such a lovely quiet place with foliage and birds
The view over the valley is lush green and there is a large variety of flora to see.
It is not far from Central Ubud and a shuttle helps you to go and come back I did go and visit some Ubud sights but my preference became just staying in and savouring the ambience, the tranquillity and breeze added to bu the impeccable hospitality and service
\I compliment the developers for their vision!
title: Nirwana...

text: We walked into Pandawas Villas late evening and were simply bowled over by the charm of the place! The quiet ambience of the villa was enhanced by softly lit lights in the Arjuna lobby-lush greenery surrounds the lovely pool and the cool breeze from the open surroundings creates a perfect setting for a relaxing break. Delicious Balinese dinner set off our holiday onto a perfect start!  Whether its a balinese meal or a pizza or continental breakfast, the staff whips them up equally delicious on request. We stayed there for 3 nights in a well styled spacious room offering all the modern amenities of a 5-star in the boutique styled resort. Attentive staff who respect your privacy, the open styled beautiful bathroom, a drink in the 'Buddies Bar' offering spectacular views around, freshly plucked coconut, their signature 4-hand massage in a pool-side cabana have all ensured that we will go back to Pandawas for our next holiday in Bali!
title: Perfect combination of Balinese style with 5-star facilities!

text: Pandawas is an exclusive resort hotel with beautifully designed rooms. The rooms are spacious, with attention to details for every aspect of your stay. text: This is our second return to Pandawas, and I can not say enough great things about this place. Our kids say it is the best place they have ever visited and we live in Asia and travel a good bit. The place only has four villas, so a nice small boutique type feel. No request is too big and the staff is so friendly. They have beautiful grounds and an amazing pool. You can even get a couples massage outside in the cabana  area.
