text: With only 4 rooms you get the feeling of your own villa with the benefits of enjoying others.  We were traveling with another family ( with 2 kids) and the villas couldn't have worked out better.  They were roomy, clean and the kids loved the pool.  The breakfast were just right, not too over the top but enough to fill you up.  A great experience.
title: Great for families

text:
We've been to pandawas villas during our stay in ubud for 4 nights. Place and location is just perfect even though staff and services. OUTSTANDING!!!
Looking for a quiet & individual place, pandawas should be your choice. The 4 villas around the beautiful pool are large and perfectly styled. During two days of our stay we were the only guest but service was still at a very high level. Bathroom outside the villa is also a highlight. Breakfast is also at high level.
Pandawas is just a few minutes outside ubud but the hotel offers a shuttle service to ubud market. Taking a taxi is also very cheap, we've paid 50000 IRD. 

We had great time at pandawas villas, missing nothing. We would definitely come back again!
title: A dream!

text:
Pandawas is a lovely private Villa group of 4 located away from the central area of Ubud- One needs transportation given the location of the Villas to be able to enjoy Ubud's dining and tourists attractions.   a shuttle bus does run 3 times a day into the centre of Ubud.

We stayed there  and for the first few days were the only guests there.

The management and staff were extremely kind to my son and I during our stay as he required surgery.  (for this we are extremely grateful) The staff are all lovely yet quite casual and relaxed in their approach to service.  They would accommodate any request with a smile.  Whilst language was a barrier often, staff tried their best.  On a number of occasions I sough local knowledge from the staff about places and attractions but found their knowledge to be very limited.  In saying this they would always try and help by doing research or trying to find out about places we had inquired about that we wish to visit.
 
I found that not having room service available 24/7 was often impractical and the available menu at Pandawas was relatively expensive when I compared it to the next hotel we stayed at being Komoneka Bisma which management organised on our behalf and we were so happy with this wonderful recommendation.

There is no fitness center obviously as it is a very small private Villa  and there is no kids club to speak of other than an area with a play station in it that kids can use.

Our hearts were touched by the staff and Management of Pandawas Villas.
title: The possibilities are endless

text: I have visited Ubud many times in the past, and my experience at Pandawas is definitely the best one of all. The design of the villa is intricate and elegant. Their attention to detail reflects in every nook and cranny of the place: the spacious and beautiful bathroom, comfortable bed, creative and relaxing lounge furniture... Swimming in the big eco pool was definitely one of the high lights. There was no smell of chemical and being surrounded by nature. It feels like I was swimming in a lake. The villa is located in a peaceful hill overlooking beautiful ravines, away from the hustle and bustle in the touristy area. However, the villa provides shuttle bus to many points in Ubud, so I could still explore in Ubud and come back to the villa for some R & R.  The staff was very friendly, professional, and helpful. The villa provides tranquility and total relaxation. I would definitely come back here again and again.
title: Tranquility in Ubud

text: My family had a brief stay at the Pandawas villas and were really blown away. It is a beautiful seting in a tranquil part of town. A real retreat. Guests are treated like royalty - have honestly never experienced such personalized hospitality. My boys 9 and 5 greatly enjoyed the open spaces, the pool, a very well furnished games room as well as the personalized activities suggested by the helpful staff. The food was exceptional - authentic home style Balinese cooking with flavors to die for. Wonderful break for all - just what the doctor ordered!
title: Fantastic find in Ubud

text: We selected Pandawas Villas solely on The Trip Advisor write up and recommendations.  This was our first trip to Bali and we had no desire to spend time on the beach preferring a central location to facilitate touring the island.  Ubud turned out to be ideal and the choice of the Pandawas Villas was extraordinary!  The Villas only have four large suites, situated around a large infinity swimming pool, which are virtually identical differing only in color scheme and view.  We had no idea what to expect in terms of service but our standards are high; in Asia we favor the Oberoi or Mandarin hotels.  The small staff of about six rotating on the front desk were as accommodating as the best of our prior experience.  They ensured our every request was fulfilled to the max and remembered all of our standing requirements.  Their breakfasts were fresh and as complete as we wished offering both Western and Balinese cuisine.  They even offered a dinner menu that could be supplemented with special requests although after the first night we preferred to sample some of Ubud's excellent restaurants.  (A friend who has a home in the area gave us a list of recommended spots for different food preferences all of which appeared accurate.)  Although the Villas are located about 10 minutes from downtown Ubud, they offer a free round trip shuttle at several times each day and are amenable to adapt to other times for a reasonable fee.  In a nutshell, Pandawas Villas offers luxury class accommodations and service at very reasonable prices.  I give it my highest rating for quality, service, and price!
title: A Find in Bali

text: This Villa Accommodation is the middle of nowhere yet close to the town center. Very relaxing  very private. The decor has beautiful  Balinese carving, A since swimming pool, Large bedrooms. In one word it is fantastic.
title: A Great Place to Relax

text:
Great rooms, very quiet place. People working there are really helpfull and very nice too. 
An oasis of relaxing atmosphere at a few km from the crowd of Ubud.
Definitelly a good choice.
We had a car to travel around, but the villa offer facilities to go and come back from ubud. 
We stayed there for 3 nights with our 2 kids, we all loved the place
title: A wonderful place to stay!

text:
Hi, we spent 2 nights in this secret villas at 4 km up north to ubud. Taxi drivers say it is very far....but i mesured it and it is 4'300 km.

Place great, villas huge. Staff nice.

May be breakfast a bit under expectations...
title: Very nice place

text:
My husband, myself and our 2 year old daughter were absolutely blown away from the moment we arrived at Pandawas.   We stayed for a luxurious 6 nights.  We could not help relax when we were made to feel so welcome and cared for by both the staff and the owners of the property.  The food was very good and although sometimes lunch was slow to arrive if you were easy going you would appreciate it as simply because they were always getting fresh ingredients each day.  They accommodated my daughters eating schedule and she simply loved the pasta and the rice porridge.  The whole property is very up to date for technology....rooms have surround sound, cable, wifi and of course they have a great room for kids to play in with a big screen tv for their favourite shows.

We enjoyed swimming in the 25 meter pool everyday and enjoyed taking walks/runs along the road that takes you through lovely villages and rice fields.  Everywhere people were so friendly.

The room was very impressive.  Large, clean and modern.  The beds were comfortable, the room was nice and cool and the bathroom was very BALI!  Even the shampoo, conditioner and body gel was great quality.  Pandawas has quality touches everywhere.

We enjoyed getting massages and pedicures poolside.  Walking the grounds was lovely and eating in different areas (rice field view, fish pond view, grand table) during our stay was a nice point of difference.

Pandawas met our every expectation and we would go again without hesitation.  If you like laid back vacations away from it all and to feel like you have a place all to yourself....then this is for you.
title: a perfect oasis for our family

text:
We recently stayed for a week in Villa Nakula and loved our little corner of the jungle. The owners met us warmly and assured me that anything our 2.5 year old son needed or wanted would be made available. That was a relaxing gesture! The staff here were very friendly and professional, we had great conversations and they obviously cared for our little boy. 

The complex of Villas is so large and the infinity edge pool is seriously something you'd see in a resort of 50 rooms...here, you are sharing with just a few other people. We had families and honeymooners stay in the other villas during our time. You never felt like you were in anyone's space. The communal area is massive and then you also have a large fish pond, patio area and kids' games room to enjoy. We felt at home the whole time and not a single concern over security. The location ensures you have quiet evenings and we never felt disturbed by any noise in the other villas. Yes, you are situated like a duplex in two pairs but the rooms are huge, the walls are thick and there's enough space for everyone to relax. 

The design of our villa was quite stunning and the TV area inviting - surround sound Marantz amp also makes things better :) The mosquito net for our son's bed was a perfect touch and we all slept soundly. I did notice that heavy rain made the bathroom area a little tricky at times but you just tread carefully! It's still a stunning outdoor bathroom nonetheless. The outdoor bales and hammock were great but it's becoming obvious that a lot of the wooden decking needs maintenance. But we would consider the maintenance program a tricky thing when you have paying guests and unseasonable rain. 

Although there was a decent menu to choose from it was hard to say ahead of time what we would feel like eating. And the prices aren't that cheap, drinks included. Although Wayan's Long Island Ice Tea was worth it ;)) Laundry is expensive and I would definitely suggest that there shouldn't be a charge for trips into town outside of the shuttle hours. For the number of guests and the number of staff available (and the cost of staying here) any ride into town should be complementary. That's what we've found staying at similar places in the area. We were given rides into town which turned out to be free of charge and we're grateful for this. With a small child and our preference for eating in central Ubud this made life easier. The wifi was pretty much non-existent which also made trips into town more appealing. 

Thank you Annie for your help with checkout the night before our early flight. The bread baskets and water bottles you put together for 5am was so much appreciated. Nice touch! Breakfast here in the villas is more than adequate and, again, our son was given whatever his little tummy desired. This is a place for parents to relax! And we felt welcome with the owners and their family but they were only around for the first day or so. It never felt like we were intruding on their family compound or them being out of place on our holiday. This is a space for everyone to enjoy without any hang ups or bad attitudes. The smiling staff, the gorgeous amenities and that stunning jungle view ensure you feel well-looked after in your little slice of heaven.
title: "Thoughtful design, relaxing location"

photos.caption: Stunning morning mist over the pool

text:
First impressions count and after traveling for the last 21years as an airline pilot you get to see the difference between when the owner cares about the staff and service or when they only really care about themselves. The owner obviously looks after her family first as you should but not when you have paying guests. Either use the property as your private residence as was stated or as a commercial property as it was sold.
The service from the local staff was the best they could provide considering the poor direction given by the owner. 
The linen was filthy and very worn, the outside bathroom although a nice idea was very impractical and dangerous when it rained, with many sharp edges. I saw none of the "Eco" lodge as the rooms had no cross flow ventilation and therefore required the use of air conditioner. 
Meals other than breakfast were very expensive as were drinks.
The rooms themselves are just big hotel rooms certainly not villas, with a minimum amount of privacy especially when the owner and her extensive extended family roam and occupy all seating in the common area.
I have never before found accommodation that I would not return to until now. The owner needs to give her staff the tools to express themselves and develop Pandawas Villas.
title: Forget about privacy, or value for money

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

The team at Pandawas Villas tries its best to bring an extra smile for each of our guests. 

From the moment you walked into the property - you were not only arrogant, rude, condescending and disrespectful towards the front office team but also passed predujiced and inappropraite remarks at the operations supervisor, gardner and the driver during the duration of your stay. 

We at Pandawas welcome guests from all parts of the world - we do not differentiate based on color or country. The common areas are open to all as in any resort.  You however gave clear indication to the team that you find it inappropriate for your family to associate with people from a certain country. 

Linen:  We use batik linen freshly sealed and laundered from the "laundrette" - which you expressed dislike towards. Batik is an inherent part of Balinese culture and is always printed in matted shades. It does not make the linen worn out in any way. 

We endevour to learn from feedbacks left by all our guests. Last 20 reviews our guests have done back with a happy smile. 

with kindest regards
Pandawas Villas
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Right from the get go, the service was exceptional. Wayan picked us up from the airport and drove us back to the Villas (It takes about 1 hr 15mins). He was very friendly and drove carefully.

The place is amazing. There are only 4 villas in total on a large amount of land which makes it feel very private. We stayed in Sahadewa. The room was HUGE!  It is decorated and furnished very well. 

The food was delicious. As the place does not have a lot of guests at any one time, they buy and cook everything fresh. Just give the staff a little notice so they can get everything prepared. You also get the option of choosing where you would like to sit and eat. So many lovely places to choose from!

Most of our time was spent lazing by the large pool. It overlooks some lovely scenery. We also went on a half day tour with Wayan (A different one - very common name in Bali). He was also very nice and took us to lots of nice places to see.

I would highly recommend Pandawas Villas if you want to get away from the touristy areas. It is very quiet and relaxing and the staff were absolutely lovely. We really enjoyed our stay!
title: Amazing place and service

text:
Wow! What an amazing place... Such attention to detail is rare to find
The great staff will really take care of you. A delight to stay here.
The outdoor bathroom is amazing - the rooms large, spacious and cosy.
Great place to relax away from the town.
We will be back soon.
title: An amazing place with the personal touch

text:
Pandawas villa strives to be true to its mythohistorical characters it is based on and does a great job of it. The villas are set to transport you to the historic ages with its beautifully decorated rooms and awesome landscaping. We stayed in the Nakula room with great views of the valley. The rooms are enormous. Had breakfast by the Koi pond is very relaxing. Its an ideal place for families with small kids. Lots of place for them to run around in the grounds and they also have a playroom by the entrance. Appreciate the attention provided by the owners who visited the villas during our stay. Our kid was running a bit of temperature on arrival and the owners had the driver get some over the counter medicines in no time. Fortunately his fever came down for us to enjoy the rest of the trip. Loved the massage by the pool. The turn around time on the snacks could be improved, especially  for those rainy evenings to chill out in the rooms. 
Would recommend this place for people who like to go off the track and enjoy a period of tranquil and peace in a very relaxed setting. Very friendly staff make the stay a memorable one.
title: Exclusive Resort - Child friendly

text: Pandawa villas is an exclusive and quiet haven, far from the madding crowd. Beautifully designed,  with large rooms and a cosy atmosphere, it is an ideal place to relax in. Monica has done a lovely job and her staff are very attentive and helpful.  One can spend all day long lounging by the pool. One reaches the villa after passing through a lively market with good shopping options which are different from what one sees in the main Ubud market place; one also negotiates a breathtaking hairpin bend just before reaching the villa. The grounds are very well maintained and lovely for an early morning walk. Would recommend free pick up/drop to the main market place as there is no other way of getting there.  These could be at pre-scheduled times. Would recommend Pandawa to those looking for a relaxing break!
title: Quiet haven

text: We arrived at Pandawas after a bad experience at another villa and we couldn’t have been happier with our new accommodation.  The villas are so spacious and have everything you could possibly need, the outdoor bathrooms were amazing, the beds comfortable – all in all absolute luxury and you could tell that every detail about the resort had been thoroughly thought through.  The grounds, pool and ponds are stunning, we really enjoyed wandering around the gardens and the whole place is so peaceful and tranquil.  The best part of all though was the staff, I can’t say enough about them, everyone was so helpful, friendly and attentive, nothing was too much trouble but at the same time they allowed you your privacy and space, it was so easy to relax.  We all felt so sad to leave and can’t wait to return again, I would highly recommend Pandawas villas for a luxurious, relaxing break.
title: Stunning Resort

text: It was an absolute treat to stay at Pandawas Villas. Of the 8-9 places I've stayed in Balie, this was my favorite spot. The overall small scale of the villa complex creates a remote, exclusive feel but the rooms are enormous and decorated with a sophisticated modern balinese touch, creating a very indulge-yourself atmosphere.The pool and lobby area are stunning, and the perfect backdrop for the delicious morning breakfast. I loved that the location was along a wholesale shopping street... I had MANY great shopping finds. I recommend Pandawas wholeheartedly!
title: Exceeds Expectations

text: I went to Ubud for the first time in May, 2013 and stayed at Pandawas Villas.  What a gem!!  The sleek contemporary design with Balinese touch combined with beautiful, modern and trendy furniture was such joy to look at and enjoy during the stay.  The shower room is spacious and just gorgeous.  Even taking a shower has a luxurious feel.  The breakfast by the KOI pond was relaxing and peaceful.  The view from the villas was stunning.  The vast open space lobby with pretty lightening makes the lobby a very romantic and leisurely place to hang out.  The media room with big screen TV and stylish furniture looks welcoming for any families.  Everything about it made my trip to Ubud pleasant and memorable.  The location of the villas is a bit outside of the central Ubud, but it's an easy and quick drive.  The villas are very close (2 minute drive) to the main street with stores after stores of whole sale items such as home goods and interior decor.  The prices are unreal.  Best shopping experience was available only a few minutes away from the villas, which many regular tourists don't even know about but we did thanks to staying at Pandawas Villas!
title: Gem of Ubud

text:
I went to Ubud early February and took the beautiful orange Nakula room, with its red shade of interior. I had hot & spicy ayam betutu and beef ribs. yum...they're just awesome. you should try! enjoy the food by the koi pond.
I took a bicycle tour to Kintamani and had some pancakes on the way back.
title: the food and room

text:
if you like to have a hidden and private side of Bali, you should try to stay in this villa, and find a real getaway...yet still close enough to Ubud.
I always admire this stunningly designed and crafted villa. every detail was created of high quality materials. a real art deco.
I brought my family here, and I had no worries on my wife’s vegetarian diet. In fact I really enjoyed the tasty food they provided. my kinesthetic son had a lot of space to explore. perfect place for family stay.
title: beautiful getaway...

text:
When you walk into Pandawas, it exudes a warm homely welcoming feeling and it makes you feel right at home. The villa was excellent as it was spacious, clean and well maintained. The staff was friendly and very helpful especially with our 2 year old child. It is a very child friendly place with a lot of space for our toddler to run around. The villas are in a very quiet and peaceful area with lush green surroundings (which is what we preferred). The setting is truly beautiful the gardens are relaxing and you feel immediately at peace. The breakfast was fresh and satisfying, good quality.
I would definitely recommend this villa.
title: We had a lovely stay!

text: We stayed here for three nights before making our way to Seminyak. It's a lovely villa with everything we needed. The staff were friendly and helpful. the breakfast is delicious. If there was any cons it would be the price charged to go to Ubud centre, we paid 70.000 Rp which is quite pricey especially when we can get a driver to take us back for 40,000. Other than that it was great, would recommend to families and couples.
title: Peaceful and beautiful

text: Far from the madding crowds, yet close enough to cultural Ubud, Pandawas Villas is the perfect getaway. From the moment you enter the beautiful, naturally landscaped property, the mind & body go into 'relaxation mode'! There are only four, very large, aesthetically designed luxury villas, each with its own theme- from the design of the furniture to the colours of the linen & walls, to the scents of the toiletries and aroma fresheners. I loved the open-air bathrooms, created in true Balinese style! Swimming in the infinity pool under blue skies, or under the stars; watching the setting sun from the 'Buddies bar'; a relaxing 4-hand massage by the pool; or just walking around aimlessly; it's all here! Being a 'foodie', I was amazed at the variety and flavours that we were presented with at every meal. The croissants were just 'yum'! The cooks catered to even vegetarian needs and came up with exotic fare. The ever-smiling staff were there when you needed them and yet not in your hair, which was lovely! Thank you Pandawas for a memorable holiday and we'd love to visit again.
title: Haven of Tranquility

text: The Pandawas experience is an holistic one encompassing the location a few minutes taxi ride out of Ubud,the wonderful rooms in an enchanting garden setting and the wonderful staff who attended our needs so graciously.We would like the management to especially note our commendation of Annie and Kadek who went out of their way to assist in making our week at Pandawas Villas a memorable one
title: Serene and Sublime

text:
This time I planned to stay for 7 days so I could see more of Bali. But as it rained a lot for the first 3 days, I decided to take some time off and relax at the resort. All I did was swim, chill out, eat, sleep... and not to forget... get some massages. This time it was different. I was told about the 4-hand massage where two masseuses would perform a synchronised massage. Got that a few times... have to say I've never experienced anything like that before. I haven't heard of it anywhere else. Thank you, I enjoyed it a lot.

Another thing which I can't thank you enough for is food. Due to my strict vegetarian diet (mostly vegan), it is very difficult for me to find a decent meal... even if food is available, not being able to communicate in the local language makes it difficult sometimes. Unfortunately, many places I go to do not understand the difference between serving vegetables and serving vegetarian food. You understand my dietary requirements and cater to that. Thank you for that.

The staff is very polite and helpful.

I've upload some Pandawas pics I clicked with my iPhone and iPad. Would suggest this place to anyone who prefers to live in a place so quiet and peaceful surrounded by pure nature. I'll let the photos do the talking.
title: Thank you for making my stay memorable... yet another time

photos.caption: View of neighbouring rice fields from the Buddy bar
View of Pandawas from the Buddy bar

text: We had an amazing stay at the Pandawas last week for 3 nights. Pandawas truly is the Ubud experience one seeks - lush greenery all around, calm, serene, and peaceful. A great place for families... our room was spacious, the kids had a lot of space to play around the property aside from the entertainment room and of course they loved the pool. The staff were very attentive and good with the kids. All in all, a wonderful stay, and we look forward to going back.
title: Amazing Pandawas

text: My weekend at Pandawas Villas is an experience I will always remember fondly.  The property is situated around 1 to 1.5 hours drive from the airport, and as you turn off the busy road to Ubud towards Pandawas, you are suddenly transported into a quiet, serene and lush green forest.  The Villa itself is breathtakingly beautiful.  The rooms are very tastefully decorated to reflect the local Balinese Hindu style, and equipped with all the mod cons that make a holiday comfortable.  The bathrooms are stunning, the most striking feature of which is a huge shower area - under banana leaves and coconut palm fronds - yes - under the blue sky!  The outdoor deck, the dining area and swimming pool are also beautiful.  The pool has a children's play area and is very child friendly.  They have a nice secluded bar area - the "Buddies Bar" which gives a birds eye view of the resort and the surrounding area.  And the best part is the massage area by the pool which overlooks a lush green valley, where you can be pampered by their signature "4 Hands" massage - yes, that's 2 masseuses!  The food is freshly cooked to order, wholesome and delicious.  A special mention about the staff who are friendly, courteous, give you your privacy but are available when you need them.  They are happy to cater to every reasonable request.  Overall a fantastic experience.  Well done Pandawas - like the Terminator, I'll be baaack!
title: A Luxury Home Away From Home

text:
A holiday in Paradise
Pandawas Villas is a place to go to if you want to enjoy the peace and beauty of Ubud. The coconut grooves, the half olympic size pool, spacious gardens and rooms are so beautiful. 
As you enter Pandawas,  you will be over powered by the stretch of the green garden and the stunning Koi pond - I can just sit there for hours and read in peace. Sip my cup of tea and enjoy the feeling of peace and tranquility.
The staff are very friendly and the food is finger licking good. 
Buddy's Bar - a couple of drinks there in the evening and then to the Arjuna Bar for more drinks. I enjoyed my stay - and am already planning a vacation with my family again."
title: Excelent place for vacation

text: I stayed with family with two young kids for 7 nights in July 2012. The property is serene and beautiful. Kids loved the entertainment room which had plenty of things to do for them. Staff is extremely fond of kids and we had time to ourselves when our kids were taken care of in the entertainment area. Food is amazingly fresh and tasty. Everything is cooked to order and there are no time restriction for any meals including breakfast. We would typically have breakfast past 11 am in totally relaxed setting by the koi pond. The place is close to Ubud market with just a five minute drive into the city and yet it is totally secluded with a very calm and serene and peaceful setting. We would definitely come back again and loved our stay here.
title: Blissful Stay At Pandawas

text: My wife and I checked into the Pandawas Villas on 18th July 2012 for a four night stay. We are frequent travelers and take three to four frequent breaks for a week each every year. We have experienced the worst and the best across Europe, USA and south east Asia. Pandawas Villas easily ranks among the very best for the total experience including location, ambience, service, hospitality and food. We plan to come back here whenever we need to de-stress. I am a vegetarian and was amazed at the range and quality of Indonesian vegetarian cuisine. I will be recommending the Pandawas Villas to all my quality conscious friends.
title: Wow Experience in Bali!!!

text:
Pandawas Villas is a unique blend of space, serenity, luxury and sheer magic. I enjoyed my holiday - it has been the most amazing break. The staff are very friendly and the food is amazing. The rooms are beautiful - clean and spacious. The open air bathrooms a delight. 

Its a very child friendly place - I am planning to come back next time and will bring my daughter too.
title: Holiday of a lifetime!

text:
Pandawas Villas is decorated with a strong emphasis on Bali Hindu style, yet it is modern and sleek. The whole aura of Pandawas is refined luxury. The staff take pride in caring for the villas and for their guests. This was my second visit and I was just as happy as I was on my first visit. Pandawas provides a real getaway from daily life. It is a relaxing and peaceful world of its own. 
I like that the property is not overdeveloped. There are extensive gardens, a large koi pond and a beautiful shared pool area and there is also a TV come games room.
title: Spaciousness, serenity, beauty and gracefulness are the words that I would use to describe Pandawas Villas.

text: We had a month in Indonesia for our honeymoon and thought we would treat ourselves for our last three nights in Ubud at Pandawas Villas. It is really far out of Ubud and I had read online they offered a free pick up/drop off service to central Ubud. They initally said there was no free service, then when I said I had seen it on a website the receptionist called the manager and they came back and whispered so the other guests wouldn't hear, that they have a free service once a day. Bit of a weird start. Their car service into town is twice what a normal taxi service is. We then tried to order to room service, as an after thought asked how long the spring rolls would take and was told 2 hours! When we were leaving we enquried about the free airport drop off service they mention on their website, they went a bit weird and said they would have to check with the general manager (who was eating his lunch a metre away and could hear everything). I went back to the room, as instructed, to wait for his call. when he had finished his lunch, he called the room and informed me that because we booked through booking.com and not their website we did not qualify as we got the room for cheaper, I said its the same as quoted on your website....still didn't qualify. In the end he (rather rudely) interupted me and offered it at a reduced rate. The service from receptionists and drivers etc. was lovely, very nice people but it is a shame the general manager is not as charming. We aren't tight but it just felt like you were constantly being ripped off at this place but perhaps most of the clientele are wealthy enough not to mind. Wish we had stayed somewhere more modest and closer to town.
title: Disappointing stay - felt ripped off

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for visiting Pandawas Villas. 
We apologize for any inconvenience you might have faced during your stay. 
I would however like to clarify some of the points you have raised:

1. we offer different packets through the website and other internet sites.
2. you selected the most basic option (as is clearly written on your voucher - room night with breakfast only)

You had the option of taking an upgrade packet for an additional fee which included various other services but you chose the most basic packet. Website clearly mentions packets - for a basic packet airport pick and drop is not included. 

After checking in when you saw the services other guests were availing; you demanded (rather aggressively) the same to the staff even though you were explained that yours was a basic packet. Despite your having selected the most basic packet, we tried our best to accommodate your requests and offered you discounted prices where ever possible but you wanted everything for free. 

As much as we would like to offer everything for free, we need to run the establishment in a fair manner. There are other guests who have paid for extra services and upgrades / special packets - it would not be fair on our part to charge them and offer you everything for free just because you display rude and aggressive behavior towards the staff who are trying their best to serve you and bring a smile back to your face. 

We clearly mention to each guest that meals are sourced and cooked fresh and hence we request orders to be placed a meal in advance if possible - we do not store anything in freezers. You did not order any spring roll - so there is no question of it being delivered to you after 2 hours. 

The team went out of their way to make your stay memorable. They too were taken aback by your unjustified demand on discounts and free services. 

We still hope you have taken back good memories from Pandawas and the Island of Bali. 

kindest regards
Pandawas Management
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We spent three days here and it has been a magical experience. Pandawas Villas is set in lush and beautiful scenery - it felt like magic arriving here late at night; the stone lions guarding the entrance to the resort proper, the friendly staff offering ginger tea, the dimly lit pool and surrounding villas. We called ahead to order a late dinner from the complimentary airport pickup and was treated to a very good meal served by very very friendly and proffessional staff. When taking to the pool early morning the day after we were almost awestruck by the exotic scenery. Pandawas offers plenty; tranquility, beauty, luxury, greenery, friendliness. Service is great, meals are good. We are a family of four with two children of 6 and 3 and we all enjoyed just staying here, taking in the lifestyle and being treated by the super friendly staff. When not in the pool our daughters were playing in the dayroom, sometimes together with some of the staff allowing me and my wife to relax and being pampered by massage overlooking the jungle outside the Pandawas. Truly recommended! Since there are only four villas this makes a great multi-family retreat - that's what we are planning next spring!
title: Tranquil magic with personal touch

text: We had a two night stay at this fantastic hotel. It is perfectly situated just outside of Ubud in the rainforrest. It offers you a total relaxing atmosphere, with magically furnished rooms, nice pool and almost mythical surroundings! The personal and friendly staff really give the extra for your wellbeing! We will come back, more than two nights for sure the next time!
title: Personal and delightful retreat at Pandawas!

text:
When both my husband and myself reached Pandawa villas we were absolutely spellbound by its beauty and  the wonderful decor.of each and every corner. Immediately we were welcomed with so much warmth by all the staff.We were taken to our villa and felt so pampered and protected. All our requirements were already taken care of.  They seemed to understand our needs without even being told.The  warm welcoming smiles on every member attending us just washed away our tiredness..
In the morning we felt so very fresh and peaceful after a good nights rest . It was in the morning that we gradually noticed the perfection of the spacious rooms and understood the historical background of the decor of the room. We really loved the way the whole place revolved around the five  Pandawa brothers.

This resort gave us ,the rest and peace we needed at this age. The tranquility along with the luxurious amenities was what we older people needed. The food was absolutely wonderful , very suitable for our palate.

We enjoyed our walks within the boundaries of the resort. We got an opportunity to experience the wonderful green and clean nature and those amazing sounds of the night. Last but not the least the resort provided us with conveyance we needed to go out whenever we felt like.
OH what a wonderful ,peaceful holiday it was. (this is my second trip to Pandawas)
title: A  LUXORIOUS HAVEN FOR SENIOR CITIZENS

text: PANDAWAS VILLAS offers you a relaxing,enjoyable,tranquil experience to remember.Set amidst UBUD area of bali famous for hand made wooden and stone carvings .AT PANDAWAS you can pamper yourself with awesome massage,customized meal options,nice swimming pool  plus spend some quality time with your spouse/partner and loved ones admiring the serene nature .lots of places around the villa to explore and shop for some real good traditional balinese hand made wooden carvings.A place you would crave to revisit again and again.
title: magical !!

text:
Stayed at Pandawas Villas in Ubud from 9th to 12th March 2012. It was a great way to relax amidst lush green surroundings, totally luxurious and tastefully designed property - away from the crowds yet close enough to Ubud main areas. I was picked up from the airport with no hassles. The road to the property which winds through tall trees and steep inclines - and over a quaint bridge - sets the tone as you approach the villas. The resort has lots of stylish design touches (open architecture, wall hangings and paintings inspired by Indonesian art such as "wayang kulit" - the leather puppets etc.)

Rooms are truly large - more like a big villa. The large swimming pool nestles in the trees and almost borders the forest. The staff was unobtrusive yet courteous. They organized local tours in their van and the driver was friendly and knowledgeable. 

Lots of nooks in the property to read a book or just take a nap. The entertainment room is well stocked with games, a PS3, DVDs etc - I did not need to use it much, though!
Had the breakfast in their lookout over the rice fields - you can choose where you will eat breakfast / lunch etc - the staff will set it up as you are reaching there and breakfast will be served there. Would definitely suggest the rice-field-look out area - great experience as you can see the surrounding areas and people working rice fields in the distance.

On one of the days, walked back from Ubud main market to the villas - a fair bit of walking distance but got to experience a more "local" side of Ubud in that walk.

In general, I found my stay greatly relaxing and unwinding - stylish and luxurious. Would recommend very highly.
title: Total rejuvenation - great combination of stylish luxury and tranquility

text: Was picked up efficiently from the airport and escorted to my room on arrival. A very nice spacious room with a view over the pool . Had an amazing massage in the morning, a wonderful lunch and then sadly it was time to leave.....
title: Tranquil stay

text: Pandawas Villa was like a home away from home - with full comfort and hospitality par excellence !! right from spacious and most comfortable rooms and a quiet dip in the infinity pool was mesmerizing...the staff was extremely courteous and displayed high levels of professionalism - and made every bit of our stay comfortable. Spending an evening in the rooftop buddies bar with the stars above was simply an out of this world experience.
title: A great destination for a peaceful holiday

text: Pandawas Villas is a 5+star experience on a personalised scale. The staff will graciously take care of your every need and request. Just relax, enjoy your beautiful room, swim in the amazing pool and unwind. The decor is superb. The grounds are spacious and beautiful. Pandawas has everything you could expect in the best Bali properties.  But most of all Pandawas has a special feeling of tranquility! I really loved my holiday there!
title: Pandawas Villas is a luxurious retreat where you will unwind, relax and forget about the world.

text:
I stayed at Pandawas Villa in Ubud for 2 nights for a nice get away holiday in Bali, after spent 5 nights at Nikko Hotel in Nusa Dua, with my best friend and her family from Singapore and her friend from Melbourne and Bangkok, Thailand. We loved the peace, quiet, beautiful and elegantly done up property. Despite of a misunderstanding over a very small issue with the villa manager, we thoroughly appreciated the superbly helpful and polite of the staff during our stay.
Will definitely come back!
title: Get away with friends and family

text:
Sadly, we were disappointed.  We spent a lot of time on the grounds and relied a lot on the service.  While everyone was VERY friendly, they were simply not trained/managed to come even close to the service level you expect for this price.  Not one meal was served as it should be - set of cutlery would be missing, or salt, or water, coffee would arrive 10 min after we finished breakfast or egg order was mixed up.  While these things happen everywhere sometimes, the consistency was rather tiring at the end.  One day kids were given two plates of food with nothing else - and kids choking on their food with ketchup fingers have difficulty waiting for several min to get a glass of water and some tissues.  When I asked for a comb, the lovely and helpful lady at reception .....dived into her own handbag...  so where do you start in this case? 
The manager was absent and distant, acting rather like a part of the sleek decor than caring about his guests.  He tried charging us a bottle of Sauvignon Blanc that was orange in colour and tasted like port.  He insisted this was some sort of special type of white wine (orange!), and regardless of what has the truth - you either warn your customers upfront that your white wine is "special" and orange, or just manage their expectations without making them feel like idiots.  This discussion left an nasty after-taste.
When we tried to watch a DVD, the system crashed 7 times. We abandoned. On a departure day printer was broken and they could not print the bill.  We asked to send it to us later by mail, as we had to share some of the costs with another villa... Over two weeks, and we are still waiting.  I doubt they will bother... Sad.
If I was reviewing for design magazine - yes, 5 stars.  But if you are truly staying on the grounds, prepare to be patient.....
title: Would have been great, BUT...

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your recent visit and stay at the Pandawas Villas. We value each and every guest’s feedback and comments and truly appreciate the opportunity to improve our services and the quality of the guest’s stay at the Pandawas Villas.
 
Further to your comments, we would like to once again apologize for the delay in the restaurant service that you had to face and the faux pas regarding the comb that you had to experience during your stay with us. We endeavor to keep all guests happy and continuously strive to improve both the quality of our staff and services to all guests.
 
The manager met you both personally during your stay with us on numerous occasions and was happy to assist whenever asked. The Sauvignon Blanc that you initially ordered was indeed a bit off color and we are happy you were satisfied with the second bottle of wine. We did happily take the charges of the initial bottle of wine from your bill too at the time of check out, so we are sorry to read that you still felt upset. But do please note many a time a bottle can become off -color and it is not something which is always under our control. 
 
Though we  all did our best to ensure that your stay with us was an enjoyable and a memorable one, I am once again sorry that you felt us lacking in quality. 
 
We appreciate your taking the time and leaving us a feedback. However it is very confusing to note your strong negative comments which are quite  contrary to the mood of the positive feedback that you had left us with at check out and in our personal conversations during your stay with us.  We wish you had given us the slightest indication of how you felt during the time of your stay. 
 
The bills that you had to settle manually due to both our printers coincidentally breaking down at the same time during your check out have already been emailed to your personal email id. Please check. They might have gone into your spam settings by mistake. 
 
Once again, on behalf of the management and the entire team of the Pandawas Villas, we extend you our sincere apologies and assure you of our very best during your next stay with us.

kindest regards
Pandawas Team
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: My partner and I were looking to get away from it all for a few days and Pandawas Villas was just what the doctor ordered.  We loved the peace, quiet, and tranquility and thoroughly appreciated the three days we were there.  The rooms were spacious and well appointed, with many nice touches such as the surround music system.  The staff were always at hand to help and make sure our stay was a hassle-free one.  The Indonesian food was fresh, spiced just right and served at a location of our choice (room, communal dining, by the water or with a beautiful view of the paddy fields).  We will be looking no further in Ubud.  This is our home away from home.
title: Just what the doctor ordered!

text:
We stayed in Pandawas after being in Nusa Dua for a few days, at the start of the year. We loved it! The property is elegantly done up, the staff is superbly helpful and polite, we got excellent 4 hand massages done, surrounded by green translucent forests! Our rooms were fabulous... (I want rooms like these every where I go!) and the mix of luxury and simplicity was lovely. We went to Ubud every day, swam in the pool and ended up eating quite a few of our meals at the resort. Even when something wasnt on the menu, the staff put it together! Our personal breakfasts were served anywhere we wanted - even on topof the machan-like view site! The resort was our refuge - and although we had orginially intended to spend much time going around Ubud and Bali, it was so superb that we ended up just enjoying the luxurious surroundings and warm attendance at the resort!
-A very happy traveller!
title: Wonderful holiday in luxury!

text: We stayed at Pandawas Villas from 12/28/11 - 01/6/12. Our overall experience was excellent. We loved the personal touch and were impressed by the friendly staff. Great location amidst the rice fields at about a 10 min drive from down-town Ubud. It's a small resort, consisting of 4 large villa's with a large pool to be shared. Notwithstanding its boutique style, the resort is very child-friendly, which offers some challenges if you enjoy reading a book or taking a nap poolside. We can highly recommend staying her for a long weekend of short week - the menus are great but somewhat limited. They only use fresh ingredients and offer you a tailor made meal (within the limits of the menus).
title: Beautiful place amids rice fields

text: Lovel Bali and love this place. Always a peaceful experience. Will go again.
title: Again... excellent experience

text: I have visited this after nearly a year. To my surprise i found that the experience only gets better. Like wine this has matured. I enjoyed my relaxed holiday but the staff service and great views made it one which was really memorable.
title: Relaxing and Luxurious Retreat

text: We had a fantastic stay at pandawas. Excellent service and friendly staffs. I feel right at home. Very classy interiors with great amenities. The rooms are spacious and perfect for a relaxing weekend. If you're looking for serenity and a place for rejuvenation, this is the perfect place to have your vacation. When you're in Bali, it is a must to stay here.
title: 10 star accommodation! The best of the best!

text:
Besides misleading description and confusing pricing between the hotel directly and Hotels.com/Expedia, I summarize my review as "A doubtful Rank #1 which needs a major rejuvenation"

Serene - yes
Tasteful Interior - yes
Privacy - yes
Friendly staff - yes
Exotic - yes
Peaceful - yes
Beautiful Garden - yes
Kids Club - yes
Stunning view of Paddy Fields - yes

Cleanliness - poor, especially sofa, extra bed, floor
Quality bedding sheets - below average in both rooms I stayed
Accessibility from city centre - poor
Complimentary area shuttle - only if you pay full rate apparently
Bath tub - broken hinge makes dangerous wooden plank float when water filled
Broken air-con - yes
5.1 entertainment system - missing wiring connection
Bicycle rentals on site - myth
Hiking/biking trails on site - not true
Mountain biking on site - not in existence
Scooter/moped rentals on site - dont think so
Restaurants with fresh spices and hours of advance booking - nice way of rephrasing reality
Floor butler - not 5 star

There are only 4 rooms in this villa, with a shared pool. The rooms are adjoining 2 by 2. One has to be realistic and realize there is no economy of scale to offer full fledge restaurants and spa services.

If those listed as "yes" above is what you looking for, this is the place to go for.

Otherwise - you will get much more with the same budget staying somewhere else.
title: Rejuvenation needed here!

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,
 
Thank you for the feedback. We aim to work on the addressable points you have highlighted for us. 
 
At the same time we would like to also take this opportunity to explain some of the misleading issues you have pointed out:
 
1.   You booked a basic room package through online booking engine hotels.com without any additional complimentary items. We already shared and explained to you that there are no additionals to the packet you have requested much before your arrival. You only wanted to pay for one extra bed and also did not want to pay for breakfast for your 2 children. You requested us for price details on each item before making the booking and also on details for " all paid extra services". 
 
Please understand as much as we would like to offer you "free / complimentary services" - we run a business and hence offer options for the guests to select from. 
 
2.   You were aggressive and condescending in your tone and mannerisms to our staff. While you were staying with us, we had expressed concern about your behavior to hotels.com.  Despite all - we still did our best to accommodate your requests to the best of our capabilities. 
 
3.   Rooms - from the very beginning as on our website as well - we have shared that being an eco-resort we only have 4 luxury villa rooms spread over 7000sq.m. We are 5 min by car from Ubud center [precisely 3.9km from the Arjuna statue in Ubud]. The fact that we’re only 4 large suite rooms on a 0.7 hectare property which is secluded and yet 5 minutes away from Ubud is something that most of our guests appreciate. This allows them seclusion, privacy and yet proximity to Ubud. There is a shuttle service in morning/evening for drop/pick-up.
 
We have an eco-pool half an Olympic size, which is shared, by the 4 luxury villa rooms. Do note that most big resorts in Bali or otherwise have similar or smaller pools shared by much more number of rooms. You were aware of all these points before you booked. We even sent you the brochure with photographs before you confirmed the booking. Hence it was very shocking for our staff to be subjected to your constant complaints.
 
Day 1  - you requested for a baseball ground for your kids - we have never claimed to have a baseball field in our premises. 
 
Day 2 - you complained that we do not have a soccer field where your kids can play a match - again we have not claimed to have any soccer field in our premises.
 
Bike rentals - as explained to you before your arrival, we provide this service as a package tour. You wanted it for free.
 
Mountain biking - you have to pay for the tour for your family. This is a full day tour. You wanted it for free. The tour is run by professionals and includes meals, sightseeing and a medic on stand-by.
 
We have never claimed on our website or on any other site that we have biking/hiking trails in the premises. We offer these tours as a service. 
 
Again for scooter/motor rentals - you have to pay for the service. It was not included in your packet. 
 
Restaurants – Please note that everything cooked is freshly prepared. Given that we’re a boutique resort with 4 villas, we do not freeze or store anything. We aim to provide fresh food which most of our guests have specially recommended highly in their reviews. However there are no free items. 
 
Day 3 - After we offered you some complimentary services - you sent a thank you note to the management appreciating that we were going out of our way to assist you and family. 
 
Best Regards,
 
Pandawas Management
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We were at that hotel for 5 days/nights in July 2011, me, my wife and our 2 daugthers (9 and 10). We chose that hotel as it is away from the crowded Ubud city and wanted to rest.
The hotel is in a very nice landscape, not too far from Ubud but far enough to not be in the urban jungle Ubud has become with traffic jams, polution and harassement of tourists (visibly not by balinese people, but by street vendors coming from other islands).

This tiny hotel is very well designed, has just 6 large rooms (called villas as each room has a very high balinese roof) with the bathroom being outdoor (but with protection walls). One remark here is that our outdoor bathroom was adjacent to the reception and one of the breakfast areas, you always feel a bit uncomfortable, hoping there is nobody nearby having his tea or watching the landscape...

The stay could have been like on the web site brochure, but there has been a number of issues that other travellers may also encounter and that are worth being noted:
- The reception phone rings loudly and is perfectly heard from the nearby rooms, day and night, as walls are made of glass and not soundproof at all. It systematically woke us either around 11PM (when about to sleep) or at 7AM (early wake up call)
- Noisy children from another villa running on the wood deck and playing early in the morning and waking us up (again,most walls are glass and noise goes directly inside the room)
- Same children playing at 7AM with the bamboo piano near the reception, for 1 hour, nobody stopping them.
- During the day permanent loud chainsaw noise from forests and fields around the hotel, except Sunday (then a recommended day to stay there).
- many cocks singing early in the morning, fun at the beginning, much less after a few days

One night was especially very bad with the phone ringing during the night and not being picked up, then in the morning children from a villa playing the bamboo piano near the reception for one hour from 7 to 9AM. That's one of the worst night I even spent in the past months, I would have burnt that bamboo piano if I could...

An issue: there is virtually no amenities (ie: cotton) in the bathroom, and travelers choosing a luxury hotel/villa don't bring amenities with them.
Also we were 4 in the room (2 parents and 2 children) but everything was setup for 2 people (like just 2 water bottles in the bathroom). Also when you book a family room they just add 2 mattress onthe floor, without any mosquito net. I informed the management, I hope they will be able to fix that.

Beware: on the booking page of the hotel they ask for 2 dates. On all hotel web sites, worldwide, the 2 dates that are requested are check-in and check-out dates. But that hotel booking page is different and considers and charges the night of the second date. We got trapped and booked/paid one more night than wished and refund was declined when we discovered the issue,on-site. We had booked the following nights at the Westin Bali so ended up paying one night extra. BTW, Westin is fantastic but won't replace a few days in Ubud. At least we rested very well there...

Those problems aside, the staff was always very good in helping us and advising visits, we really appreciated it.

To summarize: that hotel is very nice, in a nice environment but definitely not made for people to rest (I would not recommend it for a honeymoon unless the reception phone ring is muted, it is a Sunday with no chainsaw and you make sure there are no kids in the 5 other rooms). It can be a very good hotel for people not staying/sleeping long.

Although they need to improve some things to justify their current prices and the "Luxury" tag they use, the staff is very helpful and kind and that's already a good start.
title: Was expecting better

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for your review. We feel comforted by the fact that you were well taken care of by the staff and hence had a relaxing rested stay at Pandawas.

I would like to positively respond to each and every point you have highlighted for us to work upon:

1. Our location: we are in a very quite part of Ubud in the midst of coconut groves and paddy fields. Across the valley during your stay unfortunately there was construction going on - accounting for the noise -  We apologize again for this. We have already discussed this during your stay and have offered you compensation. 

2. Booking engine - we follow the same system as all other online agents - number of room nights you prefer to stay. The packet booked by you was a 3 nights stay packet. You booked 2 packets - for 6 nights stay - This means check in Day 1 and check out Day 7. Upon your booking in April we have communicated via email on all activities you wanted to do during your entire stay - day by day.  You have confirmed your happiness on emails to us for the complete proposal. 

During your stay - you realized that you had double booked a room night with another hotel and you wanted a refund. August being a peak season - we cannot offer any refunds at last minute on room nights booked.

3. Excited children - Being a small boutique property there can be times during breakfast when kids are having too much fun. We did speak to the parents and removed the bamboo piano on your request. Once again we apologize. 

4. Open Bathrooms - As already explained to you - architecturally the property is designed in a typical Balinese style - taking care that all guests have complete privacy. 

5. Cocks singing in the morning - This is Ubud and we are surrounded by paddy fields. 

6. Extra beds - we use chiropractor king koil mattreses on a bamboo mat. We feel this is way much better than rollaway spring beds which are very uncomfortable to sleep on. 

7. Amenities - we fill in amenities daily. If a guest needs additional - as already shared - you simply need to request and the staff deliver it to your room.

8. Children - We are a child friendly property (one of the reasons you booked with us since you were traveling with 2 children). We love kids and want families to enjoy their holiday. We cannot refuse families booking based on the request of one guest that there should be no other other kids in the other luxury villa rooms. I am sorry but this is against our basic principal. 

Once again we would like to thank you for your booking. We hope to see you again at Pandawas. 

kindest regards
Pandawas Management

text:
Well, what can I say that others haven't already said before me. 

Planning a trip to Ubud for my sisters 50th Birthday, I wanted somewhere special and memorable.  A location where my sister could feel like a princess.  Well, I found it... from the first contact with Pandawas thru tripadvisor. I felt like I new them personally, I was treated with such warmth and helpfulness the words go beyond customer service. 

Trying to appease 9 people on a budget was the most difficult but they assured me nothing was impossible.  We arrived early afternoon and were greeted by all the staff, just like family welcoming us home.  They provided cool coconut drinks, freezing cold wash clothes and beautifully scented frangipani floral lays and that was just the welcome. 

Because there were 9 of us we were able to reserve the entire property which was fantastic.  

The villas were amazing with each having their own special theme and meaning based on a the ancient Hindu saga "The Mahabhrata which tells the epic tale of the five Pandawas brothers" .  They are fully equipped with sound system, flatscreen tv, aircon, decor to die for and own personal bathroom amenities.. so indulgent!

The evening was arranged earlier with a special dinner for Jenny's 50th..the food was beautiful with something from all parts of the world and all tastes. Pandawas surprised us by presenting her with an amazing Black Forrest Birthday Cake, Bali style and the ultimate gift of a gorgeous little balinese dancing girl ILUH ...she was just amazing and the hi-lite of our evening, thankyou.

The pool and surrounds are everything the photos show and more and to rise early morning to the forrest awakening is truly memorable.

The 2nd day we were invited by the staff to join them in their temple to give offerings and prayer,  this is something we will cherish always.

We spent the following day at the Bali Zoo getting up close and personal to baby orangutans and other amazing wildlife...before coming home to our paradise Pandawas,  for a relaxing massage, another swim and fabulous dinner.

I cannot recommend this property enough if your looking for that very special place to unwind and be treated like royalty. Like I said "we asked for a hat and they presented us with a crown"...and not just for Jenny but for all of us. 

Congratulations to Management and all staff.
title: I asked for a hat and they delivered a crown!

photos.caption: Over view from top of property.
View from pool relaxing in hammock
Coy pond and fountain looking back to main lounge area..
Outlook from one of the villas...

text:
We stayed at Pandawas for 4 nights and absolutely loved every minute of it. 

The rooms were large and spacious and tastefully decorated. It shows when the proprietors have taken the trouble to appoint the rooms with tasteful local art and high quality bedding. There is nothing 'standard' about the villas - everything is unique and has been carefully thought out. Each villa has a distinct personality based on the Pandawa brothers, and it's reflects down to the littlest detail - such as the scents and colors used in each room. 

The bathrooms - aaah! Copper bathing tubs - in a garden like setting. Bliss!

What we loved the most was the absolute privacy we had while we were there. With only 4 villas, this is a perfect location for a private and exclusive holiday - no crowds or buffet service. The staff are there when you need them but more of the time we felt like we were on our own private estate. 

The location is off from the main central town - about a 11 minute drive by car. The villas can arrange drop-offs to town and it's easy to take a cab back to the villas even if you stay out till late in Ubud town. 

Of  note is how perfect Pandawas is for children. The lounge has a children's playmat and a wide range of toys and even an extensive childrens' DVD collection. Our son loved the Koi pond and the staff were kind enough to give us fish food. I loved how personalised the service felt. 

My husband and I arranged for individual massages. It was done in the privacy of one of the thatched tents besides the swimming pool but with a view of the forest and fields. Sure beats that annoying music they play at spas elsewhere.  I requested a pre-natal massage and they had no problem arranging for a masseuse who knew what to do. 

If you have any doubt about staying here; don't hesitate even for a moment. It's a perfect getaway from the crowds. It's authentic yet luxurious -  a reminder of what good hospitality should look and feel like.
title: A perfectly private oasis

photos.caption: Koi Pond next to the lobby area
The lobby and dining area surrounded by beautiful landscaping

text:
This was our first trip to Bali. It was a last minute decision to celebrate my 40th on a holiday instead of a party. We traveled with our 3 children aged 6yr, 3.5yr and 1.5yr. After 3 nights in Kuta, 4 nights in Semiyak we finished with 5 unforgettable nights (6 days) in Ubud, staying at Villa Pandawas. We were staying at Pandawas the first week of October 2010 in 2 Villas.

Villa Pandawas is breathtakingly beautiful! – An exclusive resort for an unforgettable experience. Exquisite style set amongst secluded tropical forest and gardens.

We would highly recommend Pandawas to:
• Honeymooners
• Romantic stay
• Celebrations or special occasions
• Groups of friends (4 Villas in total)
• Families and extended families - don't let the opulence fool you - the staff are very down to earth and adore children.

The 7 star treatment started the moment I made an enquiry with the Manager calling me personally to answer any questions I had as it was a very last minute booking. Correspondence was immediate and hassle free. Our complimentary transfers from our Villa in Semiyak and to the airport were on time without a hitch. The hospitality of their staff was exceptional and our children love them all dearly as they became good friends. Nothing was ever any trouble for the staff and our requests were always met with a genuine smile and dealt with immediately. We were sad having to say farewell but we hope to return someday.

5-7 mins drive north of Central Ubud in Tegallalang (famous for terraced rice fields). It's secluded, yet well located to tourist attractions such as the Botanical Gardens, Elephant Safari Park, Egret roosting attraction and the terraced rice fields, along with central Ubud. 

Pandawas is less than 12 months old (time of writing review). The place has been built in harmony with it's surroundings creating a sense of serenity. There are expansive gardens and meditation ponds to explore (kids loved this) along with a games room which contained TV and videos, video games, board games, chalk board, puzzle mat, books etc. The kids even ate their dinner in there one night  while "Mum & Dad" had an uninterrupted romantic meal together. Other child friendly items included; baby cot & High chair to Australian safety standards, inflatable pool toys, babysitting, child friendly menu. The swimming pool was also child friendly with 2 areas much shallower for young kids (perfect for my 3.5yr) and then some very wide steps which served my 1.5yr old perfectly as he loved to explore the pool with independence (naturally with me by his side). The pool was big enough to swim laps and looking over the horizon edge was lovely.

Most nights we chose to eat at Pandawas as the food was so fresh (they would collect the fresh ingredients daily) and then we were able to relax on our front deck (children fast asleep) with cocktails in hand, listening to cicadas ringing, frogs croaking, geckos click-clacking, and some nights, the pattering of rain. This is when we were glad to be a little bit out of central Ubud!

We can't wait to return to this place of paradise!

Noteworthy aspects:
• Unique garden bathrooms with double vanity, bath, shower (with huge rainhead and handheld head), hairdryer, robes, slippers, sewing and shaving kits etc
• Fabulous hot and cold water with good flow
• Purest soft and fluffy white towels
• Egyptian cotton bed linen
• All powerpoints were multi-national (accepting all Country cords)
• Robe area with makeup table with excellent lighting
• Lots of wardrobe space for storage of suitcases and clothes
• Combination safe 
• Excellent Villa lighting with extra switches mounted next to beds (all switches had tiny lights so you could locate them in the dark)
• Surround sound stereo system hooked up to the large LCD TV in each villa with iPod dock & DVD player (included a Marantz Amplifier)
• Free WiFi connection
• Fresh organic food
• First class friendly hospitality from staff
• Massage hut looking out to tropical forest
• Double hammock with tropical forest outlook
• Air conditioned Villas and Games Room (containing some good DVDs and reading material for adults also)
• Driver service for pickup/dropoffs or tours
• Large infinity pool with some shallow areas for young ones
• Tastefully decorated villas all with unique colour themes with the highest finishing standards
title: Tropical haven offering serenity, hospitality and immense luxury and beauty

owner_response.text:
Dear Lynne,
Thank you so much for such a wonderful review. It makes the team very happy to read that you all had a memorable stay at Pandawas. We look forward to all of you coming back. 
kindest regards
Pandawas Team

text:

title: peaceful and relaxing!!!!

text:
We stayed at the Pandawas for one week in the month of January 2010. 
Overall rating: Excellent.
Experience: This was to de-stress my hectic corporate life. The resort provided out-of-the world luxury, privacy and an environment to de-stress.
Property: the huge swimming pool with minimum chemicals, Bathtub/shower in open sky, huge rooms set an ideal ambiance. Just 5 cottages/Bungalows provided the privacy & the peaceful ambience I wanted
Staff: Professional yet friendly. Took good care of my kids when ever my wife & I wanted to go out alone. The staff helped us with local sightseeing, cuisine, etc  not listed in most travel manual. 
Location: Cant get better. On the hill-top, way from crowd yet 5 minute drive to the bustling UBUD.
Food Was good you can get local food as well as Indian food, 
Not to miss: The massage. The best in South East Asia.
Efficiency: Right from airport pick up to check-in/check-out to billing, the experience has been been 10/10.For the price they charge, this property is worth every cent
title: Truly relaxing!

text: We stayed there recently late May 2010 and traveled with 2 kids...it was unbelievable experienced ! from the time we walked up the stairs, it was nothing what we had expected, the staff was standing out near the pond greeting us, serving the lovely and beautiful drink out of coconut shell. The Main resting area, it was so perfectly done, so much comfort, warm and elegance of the ambience. We love the nice settings of the villas!! it overlooked at the river valley, beautiful tree, nice pools, its just so peaceful. The rooms are huge and beautifully done. The foods are great ! The staffs are excellent ! The villas are Luxury!  The view is breath taking. I have nothing to say other than it is beyond what we expected, i highly recommend this villas to anyone who like to stay in Ubud area....we would be definitely coming back !!
title: Beyond Expected !

text: My visit to Pandawas Villas was undoubtedly the best experience at a resort in my life, this is a statement from a seasoned traveler who, over a period of 40+ years, has visited all the continents on this earth. I strongly recommend this resort to anyone.
title: Out of this world

text:
This resort is well located. If someone wants to visit cover all of Bali, it is easy to travel from here to the North, East, West and South of Bali. There is the Monkey forest and lotus temple close to this place, lot of wholesale shops/markets around which is great.

The resort itself is very personalised, very unlike a hotel where there can be many people. Here you can have the whole resort to yourself and your family as there are 4 villas and a very personalised service.

The villas are very spacious and the unique thing is each villa has its own theme of the Pandawa brothers, its own colours. My favourite place in this whole resort was the bathroom... yes, as this is no usual bathroom you will see. It is open air... and at the same time well covered with trees and leaves for privacy. The sky is the ceiling. The copper bath tub with shower is impressive.

The food, I have to say, was excellent. I am a strict vegetarian... more close to a vegan, and I have had this problem everywhere I have been. It is very difficult for me to find a place where they will make vegetarian and non-vegetarian food separately. At Pandawas, I spoke to the Chef and he was more than happy to cater unique balinese dishes which were completely vegetarian. I felt quite comfortable eating here. I stayed at the resort for 5 days and every time there were different balinese dishes. Breakfast, as with most Bali resorts, you have a selection of the best fruits and fruit juice.

The staff is so nice and polite but then whoever has been to Bali would know that. Balinese people are extremely polite and helpful and you would rarely find a cheat. I personally haven't and I've been to Bali twice now. Everyone from the kitchen staff to the driver we got to the people who are working in the gardens and other places in the resort are always smiling, ready to help and polite. My wife and I had been given a driver and for 4 days we covered each of the directions of the island. The driver was actually the bar man but he came along with us as he knew English better than others and we had requested for someone who could converse with us and show us around... and it was fun chatting with him. I am a photographer and every few minutes I wanted him to slow down so I could take a photograph without getting out of the car... I know people around me get impatient but he showed no signs of that. He was telling us about places and culture and we discussed many topics... all in all a brilliant experience.

The resort is surrounded by rice fields and forest... of course all the time you hear birds and other creatures. The resort has its own ponds, bar, outside bar, Theatre room, plasma/lcd tv with nice sound system in every villa, and other amenities.

On the other hand, it is a bit far from the airport and it can take you some time to get to the beach but if you want to cover the whole island; want to visit the wholesale markets; but particularly want to get away from commercial environments and noisy areas like Kuta beach, this is definitely the place to check out. After all I can go to night clubs and noisy areas in my own city. The whole idea is to get away from such places. The only night life here is beautiful stars and sounds of nature's creatures.
title: Very quiet, amidst nature, very central if tourists want to cover all of bali.

photos.caption: Rice field view from the outside bar
One of the ponds and the theatre room

text: Mohit, my husband, and I spent our honeymoon in Pandawas Villas in Ubud, Bali. Ambience of the luxury villas was absolutely breathtaking and the food was to die for. Each villa and the restroom concept is unique, based on the ancient Hindu saga "The Mahabharata" which simply blew us away. That's not all, you get to use the specially handcrafted goods (stationary and toiletry) in accordance with the villa theme. We thoroughly enjoyed this beautiful and serene haven in Ubud, a perfect getaway nestled among nature. The lovely hosts made our stay truly memorable. The photos don't do justice, the splendor needs to be felt rather than seen! I would love to visit Ubud in Bali soon just to experience the serenity of these villas all over again.
title: For a taste of luxury on your honeymoon in Bali, this is the place to be.

text: Прекрасная вилла для пребывания большой компанией. На территории есть большой бассейн и 6 вилл а так же 20 номеров , нам все очень понравилось. Персонал очень дружелюбный и готовит вкусную еду . Есть метр для занятий йогой и медитаций. Место в джунглях, достаточно Тихое

text: Nos hospedados 5 noches en este maravilloso lugar. Tiene 4 villas, por lo que es un lugar ideal para estar en tranquilidad y disfrutar de las comodidades que ofrece esta villa. La piscina es amplia las habitaciones también y tienen todas las comodidades. El baño al aire libre es hermoso. Pero sobre todo lo que destaca a este lugar es la atención permanente de los que trabajan ahí. Hicimos dos veces sesión de masaje y fue espectacular. Contra los un trekking y alquiler de moto. Buenos precios hermoso lugar y la mejor atención por lejos siempre personalizada  y atentos a las necesidades de los huespedes¡¡ sin duda recomendable y volveremos ¡¡¡¡
title: Lo mejor en Ubud¡¡¡¡

text:
Romantisk og meget privat hotel, da der kun er 4 villaer på hotellet. 

Placeringen er meget fredfyldt og flot. Jungle og rismarker omkranser hotelllet. Hotellet er et perfekt modstykke til Ubud's meget travle og trafikerede gader. 

Villaen er utroligt lækker af høj kvalitet og finish. Personalet er meget søde og hjælpsomme. 

Årsagen til hotellet ikke for 5 stjerner, er pga. badekaret i villaen ikke virkede (jeg tror ikke det har virket længe), restauranten og baren har et meget lille udvalg. De fleste bruger hotellet til fredlige overnatninger og så tager de ind til Ubud om aftenen.
title: Get away in Ubud

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for your review. The team is happy that you enjoyed the stay. The Villas are indeed made with a lot of care, love and luxury. We are sorry to read that the bath did not work long - could have been a simple plumbing issue - we wish you had shared it with the staff. Our technician could have had a look at it. Its open air - and sometimes in the rain and wind leaves get stuck. 
We do offer a selection of foods and drinks at the restaurant which is kept simple on order to serve just 4 villas. We only serve fresh food. 

We look forward to meeting you again. 
Thank you for visiting us. 
kind regards
Pandawas Villas Management Team

text:
Alors l'endroit est très très beau en plein milieu d'une rizière alors que la rue commerçante n'est qu'à qqls centaines de mètres.
Le bungalow avec la chambre et la salle de bain est en très bon état. Le lit mega confort.

Concernant l'accueil, le début a été parfait. Accueil chaleureux mais dès que le manager c'est rendu compte que l'on restait que un jour le ton à légèrement changer. Un peu moins volontaire. Et il n'a pas vrmt tenter de nous aider pour le petit déjeuner. Nous partions très tôt pour un trekking. Finalement c'est une des employées qui nous a fait faire un petit dej préparer le soir.

Donc en résumé hôtel excellent, la piscine est superbe. Bungalow vrmt bien (un peu plus d'intimité peut être pour certains). Nourriture ms et restaurant parfait !
title: Nice place !
